285052395213684.description:
Off The Wall - The Naughty Noughties!
West London's Hottest Wednesday Night Throwback!
October 12th 10pm till late
Notting Hill Arts Club
Tickets : www.otw-tickets.com

Off The Wall London may be one of the capitals newest student nights (launched in 2015) but it's become the only student hang out in west London week in, week out! Down to earth, Gritty, Loud & Cheap, this is what a student night should be... plus it's f*cking FUN!

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

And this week we are throwin it RRIGHHTTT BACK TO CELEBRATE THE DECADE OF GREATNESS!
Love it or hate it, the music of the Noughties was inescapable, coming from adverts, video games and that newfangled gadget, the iPod. So this wednesday, we go through the years having a real party to some of the biggest tracks!

Not to mention £3 tickets & £2.50 drinks & free Pop corn

So if you like good music, a house party atmosphere, cheap drinks & freee sh*t, get your tickets 
NOW: www.otw-tickets.com

EXPECT:

• Drinks from £2.50!
• Free Pop Corn (yes f*cking popcorn!)
• Themed Cocktails!
• Vodka Slush Puppies!

with the Naughty Noughties theme we're going to be doing the rounds of a musical journey covering the likes of:

Ja Rule, Girls Aloud, Destiny's Child, Craig David, 50 Cent, R. Kelly, Black Eyed Peas, So'Solid Crew, Jamie T, Vampire Weekend, Soulja Boy Tell Em, The Gossip, The Libertines, All Saints, Daft Punk, Sugarbabes, Dizzie Rascal, Arcade Fire, Outkast, Mike Skinner and The Streets, Gnarls Barkley, britnet spears, Nickleback, Eminem & Avril Lavigne! + SO SO SO MUCH MORE 00'IES NAUGHTYNESS!

159898294417607.description:

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯
Wir feiern das rockigster Silvester schon im Oktober, denn ab jetzt beginnt die neue Zeitrechnung. Mit dem grünen Rockoko-Bändchen habt ihr ab jetzt freien Eintritt bei jeder Rockoko und zwar ein ganzes Jahr lang. Um dem Ganzen noch ein bisschen mehr Silvestergeschmack zu geben zünden wir in der Halle ein paar Konfettikanonen und an der Bar Schnäpse an. Trinken ist schließlich der kleiner Bruder von Tanzen und das am liebsten zu den großen Rockklassikern und aktuellen Hits aus Rock, Indie und Alternative. Poppig, hiphoppig und metallisch sind dann die anderen 3 Floors.

WENN KONFETTI, DANN SCHNAPS

1100172153351292.description:
Introducing the world’s FIRST obstacle course race inspired by the world of Harry PotterTM !

Join all of your mud-covered muggle friends as they navigate their way over obstacles that only a witch or wizard worth their wand would know how to overcome…fire-burning cauldrons, walls that appear to be 9 ¾ feet tall, quidditch quaffles flying through the air…all while being chased by demented dementors!  The 5k (3.1 mile) course is comprised of 12 wizarding obstacles to defeat, some of which may require a helping wand from a fellow witch or wizard. This is it. THIS is what you’ve been waiting for. Register today to secure your spot in what we anticipate will be a sold-out event!

THIS IS AN IMMERSIVE EXPERIENCE.

The Muddy Muggle is SO much more than just a 5k obstacle course race. Our magical gates open on the afternoon of Friday, June 16, 2017 to kick off the weekend festivities with live entertainment by Wizard Wrock bands and exciting Wizard Games in the festival village. Saturday is a FULL day of enchanting experiences beginning with the Muddy Muggle obstacle course race inspired by the world of Harry Potter. Spectators/festival goers can cheer on their favorite muggle from the sideline or spend the day browsing the shops on Horizontal Alley, participating in the numerous events and activities in Hogsbreath Hollow’s village square, or watching their favorite teams compete on the quidditch green. The choice is yours. On Saturday evening, you’ll want to come dressed to impress in your wizard best and join us for our Wizard Wrockfest and enjoy a mug of butterbeer. For those of you holding the “Prefect Pass,” you’ll join us under a canopy of stars for the Fantastic Feast, a seat-limited “farm to fork” feast filled with fresh locally, sourced flavorful faire.

As if things couldn’t possibly get any better, all Muddy Muggle participants also receive an event t-shirt, a finisher’s medal, free festival entry, and a mug of butterbeer (21 and older)!

Not just another obstacle course race! The Muddy Muggle is an immersive experience that puts YOU right in the heart of the action in our very own Hogsbreath Hollow!! Held over the course of one magical weekend, our festival gates open on the afternoon of Friday, June 16, 2017 to kick off the weekend festivities with live entertainment by Wizard Wrock bands and exciting Wizard Games in the festival village along the streets of Horizontal Alley. Saturday, June 17, 2017 offers a FULL day of enchanting experiences beginning with the Muddy Muggle obstacle course race inspired by the world of Harry Potter. Spectators/festival goers can cheer on their favorite muggle from the sideline or spend the day browsing the shops (vendors) on Horizontal Alley, participating in the numerous events and activities in Hogsbreath Hollow’s village square, or watching their favorite teams compete on the quidditch green. The choice is yours. On Saturday evening, you’ll want to come dressed to impress in your wizard best and join us for our Wizard Wrockfest where you can enjoy a refreshing mug of butterbeer! For those of you holding a pass that includes the Fantastic Feast, you’ll join us under a canopy of stars a seat-limited “farm to fork” feast filled with fresh locally, sourced flavorful faire.

Horizontal Alley

Browse the “shops” along the bustling Horizontal Alley where you’ll find everything that a witch or wizard could ask for. Catch a live demonstration by one of our numerous master craftsmen/women including candle and soap making, glass blowing, blacksmithing, and wand making! In need of a new wand? Don’t forget to stop by our wand shop where the “wand chooses the wizard.” Need to hone a few of your magical skills? Participate in potions class, divination, dark arts defense, and wizard dueling!

Village Activities

Come join the fun and participate in all that our festival has to offer! Here’s a partial list of what you’ll find in our festival square!

Hay Maze
Pumpkin Chunkin Contest
Wizard Chess
House Cup Trivia Competition
Broom Races
“Whomping Willowbroom” Mechanical Broom Challenge
Costume Contest
Autumnal Soccer
Kids’ Inflatable Obstacle Course
Horcrux Hunt
Campfire Stories in Quidditch Pitch Campground
Trick-or-Treating for our young witches and wizards
Wide World of Quidditch

Calling all quidditch athletes and fans!! Join us in Quidditch Pitch Park for all things quidditch! Demonstrations, matches, and gear expo…we have it all!

1018986964862319.description:
This DreamTrip to Beijing takes you to Badaling, a section of the Great Wall. Place your own stone in the wall and tour the Summer Palace, a regal estate composed of lush gardens, ancient temples, vast lakes and more.

What we love:
•	Walking through the great halls and pavilions of the Summer Palace, a UNESCO World Heritage site.
•	Helping to restore the crumbling stone steps of the Great Wall of China.
•	Looking out at the Forbidden City from the hotel’s top-floor sunlight pool.

What's Included
•	4 days and 3 nights in Beijing, China.
•	3 breakfasts, 1 lunch and 2 dinners.
•	Airport transfers.
•	Half-day visit to the Great Wall; includes transportation. 
•	Half-day tour of the idyllic Summer Palace; includes transportation.
•	An In-destination Support Specialist will be provided on this trip. Their goal is to ensure you have a great DreamTrips experience from landing to liftoff. They host a welcome reception on arrival day, attend scheduled activities throughout the trip, notify the group of itinerary updates and more.
•	See itinerary for more information.

Hotel Details
Crowne Plaza Beijing Wangfujing offers welcoming accommodations in Beijing’s business district. The hotel provides convenient access to Tiananmen Square and surrounded by the Forbidden City.

•	Superior Room accommodations with 1 king bed or 2 single beds.
•	Maximum occupancy 3 adults, or 2 adults and 2 children.
•	Complimentary Wi-Fi.
•	In-room safe.
•	Coffee/tea-making facilities.
•	3 restaurants and a lounge. 
•	Indoor pool.
•	Fitness center.
•	Check-in: 2 p.m. Check-out: noon.

553302868209789.description:
5 Jahre – Wasser mit Geschmack – 26.08.2017

5. Kapitel: Tieftreiben.

Wagehälse, Pioniere und jede Menge Abenteurer haben 2016 die Stellung in Heubach zum Abschweben gebracht. 

Vor einiger Zeit noch sicher und still schwebend in luftigen Höhen, vom Bass und der Stimmung treibend, befindet sich die Insel mittlerweile auf einem unaufhaltsamen Sturzflug in die Tiefen des Ozeans- zielstrebig in Richtung Meeresgrund.

Mit dem letzten Bass und dem letzten Gast, der die Stellung verlassen hat, ging auch die Energie verloren, die die Stellung zum Schweben brachte.  

Doch was genau ist passiert?  Wie geht es nun weiter? 
Findet es heraus! 

Taucht hinab in eine Welt voller seltsamer und gefährlicher Kreaturen, mysteriösen Formen und eiskalten Strömungen. 

Limitierte „Blindfisch“ Tickets: 15,00€ (zzgl. VVK-Gebühren)

511792238945596.loc_name: Amnesia London - Saturday 26th November - Electric Brixton
511792238945596.description:
Lock N Load Events presents
AMNESIA LONDON
Saturday 26th November
Electric Brixton

PRE-SALE TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
GAIN ACCESS TO DISCOUNTED PRE-SALE TICKETS VIA WWW.AMNESIALONDON.CLUB

Paco Osuna
Agoria
Cuartero
Mar-T
Fer BR

Room 2 hosted by Random
Tristan Ingram
Adam Neenan & Sam Neicho
Micky Crist
Spek•Trem
Chris Nottingham & Tommie-lee Haynes
Reece Angell & Luca Tizzano

On Saturday 26th November London’s standout auditorium Electric Brixton will be transformed like never before as Amnesia returns to the capital for its biggest indoor showcase to date. Returning to the capital following an unstoppable takeover at South West Four in August, the world’s #1 club is ready to demonstrate its brilliance once again. This forms Amnesia’s next global event following its annual closing party making this one of London’s most exciting parties of 2016.

Headlining this colossal party is one of Amnesia’s greatest ever legends and favourite underground selectors. Having played a pivotal role in the clubs development over the past two decades, Paco Osuna is admired for his intelligent and sophisticated methods and extraordinary awareness of sound aesthetics. A favourite at Amnesia’s Music On, the Barcelona-born DJ has formed an unbreakable bond with the underground as he effortlessly grooves his way across the globe stopping off at its most prestigious parties and locations. Heavily supported by the likes of Marco Carola, Richie Hawtin and Carl Cox, we can’t wait to welcome Paco Osuna, one of the world’s greatest techno talents. 

Joining him at Electric Brixton will be French mixing maestro Agoria, whose unique exploration of house and techno provides a diverse yet addictive underground sound. His work across Innervisions, Hotflush and Kompakt has continued to back up his unprecedented abilities even further along with regular dates across Europe including DC-10, Pacha, Awakenings and more. As a rare performer in London we’re extremely excited to welcome Agoria’s explicit talents with open arms as he takes us on a journey from one end of the spectrum to the other. From remixing the likes of Moby to Metronomy, the addition of Agoria is huge.

Following several stunning sets at Amnesia and a brilliant debut at South West Four as part of Amnesia’s brilliant showcase, Cuartero has become more than just an underground star and has now formed into an internationally-renowned rising talent. His multi-layered tracks and serious groove influences have made his performances incredibly invigorating, and we guarantee a fine selection of fresh cuts, beefy basslines and Balearic jams will be delivered by the Spanish favourite. Fresh from a string of high-end parties such as Elrow, Music On and Hyte, it comes as no surprise he’s marked as one of the futures most promising stars.

As the creative director and resident DJ of Amnesia Ibiza, Mar-T is one of the most experienced jockeys on the planet and boasts an impressive list of achievements and releases. Recognised as the perfect connoisseur of the dancefloor, his sets expose his hedonist and sensual spirit, his ability to create electric atmospheres full of good vibrations is second to none. Mar-T’s last London visit saw him bring Amnesia to South West Four for a truly remarkable display and with his next already shaping up to be a huge affair, excitement is already at boiling point. Eletric Brixton get ready for the Wow! Recordings boss to land with a bang.

Completing this forward-thinking line-up will be techno breakthrough star Fer BR [Live]. Creator of energetic and futuristic, groove-laden techno, FeR BR is not only the pride of Spain’s thriving underground music scene, but is without a doubt, one of the most creative artists worldwide. His diverse influences and constantly surprising tracks make sure that no two of his sets sound alike, and with his regular appearances at Amnesia’s Music On it’s clear that this is not to be missed. Globally marked as one to watch, we’re excited to add Fer BR to London.

Register now at www.amnesialondon.com  

Electric Brixton, Town Hall Parade, London, SW2 1RJ
Open from 10pm – 7am
Fully licensed bar until close
Nearest Tube: Brixton (Victoria Line) / Stockwell (Northern Line)

This November 5th, the Anonymous UK collective will again descend on central London. 
We have seen the abuses and malpractice of this government, and governments before it, we have seen the encroaching destruction of many civil liberties we hold dear, we have seen the pushes to make the internet yet another part of the surveillance state, we have seen the government's disregard for migrants, for the poor, the elderly and the Disabled, we have seen the capital, profit and greed of the few put before the well-being of the many and we say enough is enough.


We invite all the activists, the workers, the students, all doctors, nurses and all those that want to see a positive change in the world, to join us, in Trafalgar Square from 6pm, November 5th. The government and the 1% have played their hand, now it is time to play ours.

Expect Us.

Million Mask March London
November 5th Resistance Campaign
Anonymous UK

183692818715205.loc_name: Justice for Marine 'A' - London Show of Support
183692818715205.description:
On Friday the 28th of October 2016 we will once again stand in solidarity shoulder to shoulder for our brother and fellow Royal Marine Commando Sgt Alexander Blackman who is currently serving an 8 year to life sentence for allegedly murdering a Taliban insurgent who moments before was trying to kill them. 

One year ago to the date history was made by the coming together of servicemen/women and civilians to show support for one of our own and the creation of what has been widely known as the 'Sea of Green'. Sgt Alexander Blackman otherwise known as Marine A has served this country proudly for 17 years that included several operation tours fo duty in Northern Ireland, Iraq and Afghanistan. 

Whilst fighting the war in Afghanistan in 2011…

Sergeant Blackman was posted to the remote command post Omar, with 15 younger Royal Marines under his command. They lived for more than six months in a small mud enclosure, in appalling conditions of physical discomfort. Daily, they patrolled on foot for up to 10 hours in a large hostile area where the Taliban were most active. IEDs, or improvised explosive devices, the roadside landmines favoured by the Taliban, were a constant threat, to the extent that the troop seldom used their vulnerable Jackal vehicle, preferring to patrol on foot instead. They were aware that hundreds of their comrades had already been killed or maimed by IEDs. The psychological impact was devastating. Firefights with the Taliban were common. So, too, were deaths and life-threatening injuries. Overall, 42 Commando lost seven men, and a further 45 were injured, many of them very seriously indeed.

On 15 September 2011, towards the end of their fraught tour, Sergeant Blackman and his patrol were directed to an insurgent who had been fatally wounded by gunfire from an Apache helicopter. Horribly exposed in a known hotspot for enemy activity, they knew that other insurgents were in the area. They dragged the fatally wounded man to cover. Sergeant Blackman then shot what he believed to be a dead Taliban insurgent who had been shooting at his fellow Royal Marine colleague’s minutes earlier. 

Following the Court Martial and a failed appeal Claire and the family submitted an application to the Criminal Cases Review Commission (CCRC) on the 16th of December 2015 requesting that his case be reviewed and referred back to the Court of Appeal. This case was originally given priority 2, however after much consideration this was increased to priority 1 which meant that the case would be allocated  caseworker within 3 months of receiving the application instead of approximately 9 months. The CCRC have recently updated us with the fact they are making progress reviewing the case which includes going through in excess of 69 boxes of evidence and speaking to individuals involved in the case. 

This is a legal process being conducted by an independant body and that must be respected. We do not believe putting pressure on the CCRC would be within the best interests of the campaign.

As this is an extremely complex case we have been advised that it could take approximately several months before a decision is made. From there the appeal will be given a date and what we are hoping is where the final battle begins.

All that said we feel that one of our own has been let down and would really appreciate if you can make it down to London to show not only the Nation but the world that we leave no man behind and truly support those that put their lives on the line for us all. 

Fore more information on the campaign please visit our website: www.justiceformarineA.com

More updates to follow shortly......

1211487898907889.description:
Come join the USC Thornton Chamber Singers & Concert Choir on Friday, October 21st, 2016, at 8pm in Newman Recital Hall for their first Fall concert as they present a "Poets and Music" program inspired by the 400th anniversary of William Shakespeare's death. The program will include works by Bloesch, Bradford, Conte, Elberdin, Harris, Hennigan, Mäntyjärvi, Orban, Shearing, and Vaughan Williams.

Tickets are FREE but reservations are required.  All reserved tickets will be held at Will Call.  Doors will open 30 minutes prior to the concert start and any unclaimed Will Call tickets will be released to the general public 10 minutes before the concert. 
 
To reserve your tickets, please email:  
uschoral@usc.edu 

The ensembles will also be performing the program in Escondido on Sunday, October 23rd, 2016, at 4pm at the California Center for the Arts. For more information about how to purchase tickets for the Escondido concert, please visit:

http://artcenter.org/event/usc-chamber-singers-concert-choir/

Please join us November 11-13, 2016 for the second Catharsis on the Mall: A Vigil for Healing.

It will always be our goal to facilitate a free, inclusive space for healing that welcomes all to participate. You can participate through volunteering, expression, interaction, education, music, and presence. 

This year there will be interactive art, narrative braiding, speaking engagements, workshops, music, motion, and dance. Sign up to help today!
http://CatharsisOnTheMall.com/participate/

See you on the National Mall!

===========================================
===========================================

Catharsis Art Theme:
“Our Journey Home”

Catharsis on the Mall's 2016 art theme is dedicated to those who have had traumatic events disrupt or destroy their lives and our healing journey.

We gather to honor healing. We gather for art and community. We gather to shake free from the stigmas and guilt of surviving. We gather to honor and support those who travel this road alongside us. We gather to end the silent suffering of millions. We are on our journey home.

http://catharsisonthemall.com/art-theme/

446885418844748.description:
Edwartainments & Cambridge Junction proudly present 
Akala

Monday 31st October 2016 
Cambridge Junction, Clifton Way, Cambridge Leisure Park, CB1 7GX, UK
£15.50 (inc. £1.50 cmsn)
www.junction.co.uk/akala
Doors 7pm
Under 14s must be accompanied by an adult
Info & Box office: 01223 511 511

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

10 Years of Akala gives one pause for thought – here is an artist that had it in him to keep his fierce independence when it was not fashionable, has performed in over 30 countries, released 6 albums, two books, presented the seminal Life of Rhyme for Channel 4, founded The Hip-Hop Shakespeare Company and has been a tireless voice for education and social justice in the UK and all over the world.

Akala does so much it can be easy to forget that first and foremost he is an amazing musician. This anniversary release reminds us of that and the growth of a talent that has toured the UK and globally, all whilst being largely ignored by mainstream radio for the past decade. Last year alone, Akala headlined 4 sold out shows in London (2 at the Jazz Café, Rich Mix and Village Underground) addressed the Oxford Union and released part 2 of Knowledge is Power. His live show is 90 minutes of relentless tracks, backed by intense and stunning visuals, live drums, a DJ and with no need for a ‘hype man’. 2016’s upcoming tour in October promises to be his biggest yet, with a London show at Koko, UK, US, European and Australian dates also to be announced. Fresh from an East Africa mini tour (Addis, Khartoum & Juba) Akala is ready to take on the world again in 2016.

With part 4 of his legendary Fire In The Booth eagerly anticipated for later this year, an appearance on BBC2 & the RSC’s Shakespeare 400th birthday celebrations collaborating with Nitin Sawney and a reggae documentary on BBC4 to be broadcast in October, 2016 will continue to be a year of solid progress and groundbreaking, pathmaking vision from this artistic polymath.


▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

TICKETS:

BOOKING ONLINE: www.junction.co.uk/akala

BOOKING IN PERSON:
You can buy or collect your tickets prior to the event from:

THE JUNCTION BOX OFFICE: Cambridge Leisure Park, Clifton Way, Cambridge, CB1 7GX.

1494520564210678.description:
After a thrilling VegfestUK London 2015 visited by around 12,000 people, VegfestUK announced dates for VegfestUK London 2016 to be October 22nd 23rd 2016 at Olympia London.

In response to the huge amount of visitors we had at this year’s event and the overcrowding issues, we have decided to expand into the first floor of the West Hall of Olympia and keep Levels 1 & 3 of the Central Hall (which were in use for London 2015). It is our plan that with the expanded venue, our visitors will have a more pleasant experience with plenty of space and seating for everyone to relax and chill rather than being cramped in tight spaces.

The VegfestUK organisers added, “It’s a welcome problem to have to deal with massive queues and crowds in response to the massive growth in demand for everything related to the vegan lifestyle right now. We are thrilled to be able to confirm our dates for London 2016 and work in an even bigger venue, with the hope of creating an even better visitors experience. We are already thinking ahead for this event in less than a year’s time and we’re confident that our 2016 event will be absolutely amazing for everyone involved.”

Show website www.london.vegfest.co.uk

Full review of VegfestUK London 2015 - http://vegfestexpress.co.uk/tabs/blog/2015/10/thrilling-vegfestuk-london-2015-with-around-12000-visitors

Our official response to criticisms of VegfestUK London 2015 - http://bit.ly/1jvvzQJ

15-minute film "Why Go Vegan?" from VegfestUK London 2015 (courtesy of Anneka Svenska from Green World TV) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2qMsceROUy4&list=PLnDhIVB9OlwBvUiR8OJpJr4WSLHsADzdK&index=8

In the meantime, check out Vegfest’s other events:

VegfestUK Bristol – May 21st 22nd 2016, www.bristol.vegfest.co.uk 

Vegfest Scotland – December 3rd 4th 2016, www.vegfestscotland.com 

VegfestUK Brighton – March 11th 12th 2017, website live in August 2016

Also don’t miss other quality grassroots vegan events all over the UK – full details at www.vegfest.co.uk 

Stay tuned to the Vegfest Express for all latest vegan news around the globe – www.vegfestexpress.co.uk

Watch all the videos from previous Vegfest events on VegfestUK TV – www.youtube.com/vegfestuktv

1592143624420912.description:
Booking is now live via this link https://booking.nucotravel.com/cambridgemedicsandvets/

To get the ball rolling we are offering some prizes for those who book on early. The first 15 people to sign on to the trip will all get a free pair of MVST sunglasses (the yellow ones). In addition, the first 20 people to sign up will be entered into a raffle. The prizes for this are: one set of "Performance" ski hire, and two pairs of Sun God sunglasses.

This year we'll be going to Les Deux Alpes for the thrifty base price of £399. One of the top ten resorts in Europe for snow and with a thriving nightlife, L2A is the perfect resort for students. 

This trip is for everyone - don't worry if you've never skied before, just joined 4th year or don't know anyone going. You'll meet people on the trip so just sign up!

We'll be leaving on the evening of the last day of placement (16th December) and return to London/Cambridge on Christmas eve. This was the only week that would work for everyone, but don't worry, we'll be back around noon so you can get home in plenty of time for Christmas celebrations!

The trip will be run by NUCO and the MVST committee - Luke, Charlotte, Jake, Alex and Josh.

✦ BOOKING ✦

Booking will open on Saturday 24th September at noon. Just go to this link https://booking.nucotravel.com/cambridgemedicsandvets/.

For the first week, booking will be open only for clinical medics & vets, then after a week (1st October) we will open it up for people to invite guests as well.

✦ DETAILS ✦

Base Price: £399
Dates: Friday 16th December - Saturday 24th December

Includes: 
* Return coach transport *
* 6 nights accommodation *
* 6 Day Lift Pass *
* Full social schedule*
* Special prize competitions - TBA *
* Exclusive "strip-in-the-snow" show from Josh Wade *
* BYOO (Bring Your Own Onesie) *

On the way we will stop at a hypermarket so you can buy food & drink for the week cheaply. On the way back there will be an opportunity to get off the coach in/around London, and we expect to be back around noon.

✦ TRANSPORT ✦

Exact coach times are not yet finalised. We expect to leave Cambridge around 7pm on the 16th, arriving in resort late afternoon on the 17th. Then we will leave resort late afternoon on the 23rd, arriving in London around noon on the 24th, and Cambridge early afternoon.

IF YOU PREFER TO FLY: you will have to book flights yourself but NUCO can arrange return transfer for you from Grenoble Airport to the resort for £40. These would be: Outbound 17-Dec-2016 departing Grenoble 15:00, arriving at resort 17:30. Inbound 24-Dec-2016 departing resort at 06:00, arriving at Grenoble by 09:00 [you would stay an extra night in the resort for no extra charge].

✦ SKI HIRE & LESSONS ✦

- EQUIPMENT ONLY - price ranges from £79 for economy to £119 for excellence.
- BEGINNERS PACKAGE - economy equipment hire + 6 hours of lessons - ski/snowboard £119/£129

✦ STASH ✦

We'll be offering some awesome stash designed by Alex "creative genius" Black and the rest of committee.

✦ REVIEWS ✦

Here are some quotes from people who came last year:

"Only six days of skiing rather than my preferred seven... but still, bloody loved it"
- Jeremy Hunt

"Woke up every day with hella early morning stiffness" 
- Mark Lillicrap

"I pulled so many girls"
- Nathan Hudson-Peacock

"Even more fun than the Wilderness Medicine Society"
- Diana Wood

"Dear Matt Mitchard, this letter is a notification that you are required to attend a Fitness to Practise hearing following your behaviour on MVST 2015."
- The GMC

217106988683803.description:
BOTH DATES SOLD OUT 

Afterlife debut their London party over two nights at Village Undergound on Friday 11th and Saturday 12th November 2016.The duo will play all night long on Friday 11th, and welcome Answer Code Request, Monoloc and Vaal on Saturday 12th.


FRIDAY 11th November (SOLD OUT!)
Tale Of Us (ALL NIGHT LONG)
10pm - 6am
Tickets: bit.ly/2bRFkbg

SATURDAY 12th November:  (SOLD OUT)
Tale Of Us // Answer Code Request // Monoloc (Official) // Vaal
10pm – 6am
Tickets: bit.ly/2bRtCi9

 
Afterlife, an odyssey through the realm of consciousness. An event concept characterised by mesmerizing soundscapes and lush rhythms designed for the senses. A rebellion from convention into a dimension where music guides the resurgence. From hypnotic bass lines to energetic crescendos, the nuance of an immersive experience is there for the exploring. 

Having launched their spellbinding Afterlife concept in Barcelona back in June, Tale Of Us’ 13-week residency at Space Ibiza has quickly made a name for itself as one of the island’s best new parties. An amalgamation of the Berlin duo’s innovative vision and tight programming that has welcomed world renowned techno acts such as Dixon, Recondite and Rødhåd - plus a selection of progressive live acts such as Bob Moses and Rival Consoles –Afterlife will now make its eagerly anticipated London debut with a weekend takeover at Village Underground on Friday 11th and Saturday 12th November 2016.

Brand curators Tale Of Us will take the helm on Friday night with their appearance marking their first ever all night long show in London. Renowned for their innate ability to deliver raw and emotional techno which was most recently demonstrated via their ‘Realm Of Consciousness’ compilation, Matteo and Karm will then be joined by fellow Berliner and Osgut Ton affiliate Answer Code Request on Saturday 12th November. Also confirmed for this experimental weekend takeover is Monoloc, whilst Vaal rounds off the bill ahead of her upcoming Afterlife EP release.

EXCITING NEWS!!!
The Stanford Bachata Social and Dance class is BACK!!!

The Stanford Bachata Social is a great way to meet new friends, have fun and learn dancing Bachata, a sensual Latin dance that has grown tremendously in popularity over the last couple of years.

Omid and Ariana, the directors of Bachata Sentimiento Dance Company will be teaching a free Bachata dance class. No partner or experience is necessary. During the class we will be rotating partners so everyone gets to dance with everyone. Everyone is welcome for this class and the party!

So come and join us for a fun and exciting night of Bachata dancing.

1050263795066075.loc_name: FM4 Indiekiste mit José González with The String Theory
1050263795066075.description:
███████████████████████

FM4 Indiekiste mit Jose Gonzalez with The String Theory

███████████████████████

In January, 2017, José González and the maverick orchestra The String Theory embark on their second collaborative European tour since their thunderous 2011 success with sold-out shows all over the continent and raving reviews in The Independent, El País, Dagens Nyheter and Hamburger Abendblatt. 

Since the release of his third solo album, ”Vestiges & Claws” in February, 2015, José González has been busy touring and selling out venues in Europe, North America, South America, Australia & New Zealand; including The Opera House in Sydney (twice!), Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles (twice!), The Beacon Theatre in New York and The Cirkus in Stockholm. 

Even if Vestiges & Claws in a way is a comeback album, González has been far from idle in the seven years since the release of his second solo record, In Our Nature (his debut ”Veneer” was released in 2003 and has to date sold over a million copies). 
Besides making two Junip albums and touring the world both solo and with the band, and with The String Theory in Europe in 2011, González has been involved in the soundtrack for the The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty, he has contributed a brilliant version of ”This is How We Walk On The Moon” for the Red Hot + Arthur Russell charity compilation. His solo version of the Junip track ”Far Away” won  “Best Song in A Game” at the Spike Video Awards and Rolling Stone named Junip’s “In Every Direction” a Top 50 single of 2010.

███████████████████████

Vorverkauf: 
www.musicticket.at
www.oeticket.com

In allen Raiffeisenbanken in Wien und NÖ sowie auf www.ticketbox.at! Ermäßigung für Raiffeisen Club-Mitglieder.

265217413841215.loc_name: Must see SPD Conference - 19th International 3S Symposium - Seattle, Washington
265217413841215.description:
MUST SEE SPD EVENT!

This year we are bringing you the latest and greatest professionals in the field who are presenting:
• The most recent neuroimaging research that shows the validity of SPD as a diagnosis.
• Strategies for conducting therapy in natural settings.
• Abundant information on evaluation and treatment processes that every practitioner should know. 
• This event is a unique opportunity to network with other parents and professionals.

Don't miss this thought-provoking workshop with distinguished speakers. Participate in activities designed to expand your ability to think critically about Sensory Processing Disorder. There is no other symposium like it!

Who should attend:
Occupational therapists, speech language pathologists, physical therapists, special education teachers, psychologists, early intervention specialists, nurses, physicians, mental health professionals, parents and other individuals seeking a better understanding of Sensory Processing Disorder.

Featured Speakers: 

Elysa Marco, MD
University of California, San Francisco

Lucy Jane Miller, PhD, OTR/L
STAR Institute for SPD

Connie Karsari, PhD
University of California, Los Angeles

Amy Laurent, EdM, OTR/L
University of Road Island and Emerson College

Sandra Schefkind, MS, OTR/L
American Occupational Therapy Association

Sarah A. Schoen, PhD, OTR/L
STAR Institute for SPD

Rosemary White, OTR/L
Pacific Northwest Pediatric Therapy

...and several other experts in the field of SPD.


Continuing Education:

STAR Institute for Sensory Processing Disorder is an AOTA Approved Provider of Continuing Education.* The assignment of AOTA CEUs does not imply endorsement of specific course content, products, or clinical procedures by AOTA.


AOTA continuing education credit awarded: 

Pre-Symposium Institute: 4 Hours (.4 AOTA CEU)
2-day Symposium: 10 Hours (1.0 AOTA CEU)
Friday, November 4: 5 Hours (.5 AOTA CEU); Saturday, November 5: 5 Hours (.5 AOTA CEU)

*Continuing Education credits through any other associations will not be provided. Please check with your association to inquire about receiving credit for attending this program.

1737023203216282.description:
Technology and Governance: Cambridge Baltic Conference 2016 (CBC '16). 

The CBC 2016, co-hosted with the Cambridge Union Society, aims at generating a nexus of ideas that will combine the knowledge, creativity and experience of students, business community, politicians and academics to take lead in the discussions of the current state and the future of technology and governance.

The broad heading of Technology and Governance gives the conference an opportunity to discuss various matters: e-health, fintech, e-governance, talent attraction and modern diasporas, big data and governance, and much more.

The conference will also be a part of the British Estonian Chamber of Commerce’s (BECC) trade mission to the UK. The BECC’s delegation which includes a number of business leaders from Estonia will be taking part in the conference.

More information, programme and tickets: 
http://www.cambridgebalticconference.eu/2016/

1263797550320457.loc_name: Cambridge Corn Exchange: Laura Mvula @Cambridge Jazz Festival
1263797550320457.description:
Cambridge Corn Exchange presents Laura Mvula in association with Cambridge Jazz Festivall

Tickets: £22.25
https://www.cambridgelivetrust.co.uk/cornex/events/laura-mvula

Fresh from the announcement of her second Hyundai Mercury Prize shortlisting for her mesmerising and critically-acclaimed album 'The Dreaming Room', Laura Mvula announces some new UK headline tour dates. Fans can grab tickets 48 hours ahead of the crowd with our presale - it's now on!

"With Sing to the Moon, Laura Mvula set a new standard for 21st century soul. With this follow-up, she's raised that standard higher." MOJO

"Many of her songs seem ready-made for some kind of theatrical adaptation. They’re authentically dramatic, built on the swells of brass and strings and percussion, which might suddenly disappear behind some new peak of melody or meaning sung by Ms. Mvula." The Now York Times

Since catapulting into the limelight with her critically acclaimed debut album, ‘Sing To The Moon’ and touring the world, Laura Mvula is back with a new album 'The Dreaming Room'. Laura’s latest single ‘Overcome’, featuring the legendary Nile Rodgers is taken from the new album ‘The Dreaming Room’, released on the 17th June through RCA Victor (Sony). 

It’s rare to come across an artist with such undeniable uniqueness and music so lyrically poetic that it simply speaks for itself.
 
When your heart is broken down
And your head don’t reach the sky
Take your broken wings and fly
When your head is heavy, low
And the tears they keep falling
Take your broken feet and run
With the world upon your shoulders
Nowhere left to hide
Keep your head up carry on
It ain’t no time to die
Even though we suffer
Come together we pray 
 
Produced By Troy Miller who has worked with the likes of Amy Winehouse, Mark Ronson and Rumer, and co-produced by Laura, ’Overcome’ see’s Laura in a new found light - still reflecting her distinctive signature sound but showing the progres-sion of an artist who has come into her own. 

Having formed a friendship through their love of music and each others work, Laura initially sent Nile the first version of ‘Overcome’ and he loved it so much he asked to add some of his magic to the final version. Combining Nile’s upbeat sounds with Laura’s characteristic thrilling harmonies layered beneath stunning tribal beats may come as a surprise to many, but the final product is a true testa-ment to both artists musical talents and a clear development from Laura’s debut album.  

As one of the most exciting musical talents to come out of the UK, Laura has cer-tainly come along way since writing songs at home on her laptop. Now critically acclaimed, her unique character and musical mind has broken the boundaries of music once again.

959228560791794.loc_name: Fourth annual International March for Elephants in Washington DC
959228560791794.description:
FOURTH ANNUAL INTERNATIONAL MARCH FOR ELEPHANTS — DC

SATURDAY, THE FIFTH OF NOVEMBER, 2016

For the fourth year, join friends around the world calling for the end of the ivory trade and rhino horn trade while advocating to save endangered species from extinction.

Assembly Time: Begins at 11 a.m. at the Lincoln Memorial
March Start Time: Noon at the Lincoln Memorial
Rally Start Time: 1 p.m. before the White House at Lafayette Park 

ROUTE: The march procession will form at the Lincoln Memorial and will proceed over the following route: North on Constitution Avenue to North on 17th Street, East onto Pennsylvania Avenue, right on 15th street, right onto the National Lawn at The Ellipse for ap peaceful rally before the White House.

We applaud all people standing up for endangered species on around the world on Sept. 24.  

IMPORTANT: Due to the opening of the African American Museum in DC the weekend of September 24, the National Park Service will not issue a permit for Elephants DC to march as the main streets between the White House and the Lincoln Memorial will be closed. 

As an alternative, we will be holding a peaceful rally before the Chinese Embassy to the United States of America in Washington DC at noon September 24: https://www.facebook.com/events/445671698964013. 

We also encourage folks to support additional global marches across the nation and around the world.

This year, CITES is meeting in South Africa to sign a new trade agreement. We are calling for the full restoration of all African elephants to Appendix I standing as well as the immediate protection of rhinos and lions.

For National Geographic's take on the 2013 international marches, click here: http://newswatch.nationalgeographic.com/2013/09/26/marching-to-save-the-elephant-on-october-4/

Check out National Geographic's feature on the 2014 march in DC here: http://newswatch.nationalgeographic.com/2014/10/05/on-the-march-in-washington-d-c-for-elephants-and-rhinos

This event is part of the Global March for Elephants and Rhinos and iWorry movement.

For global marches from San Francisco to Rome, visit www.march4elephantsandrhinos.org.

For more on the spark which became a movement FOR elephants, visit www.iWorry.org. 

To learn more visit www.elephantsdc.org and to volunteer for the 2016 march, send an email to: elephantsdc@gmail.com.

1397828940438345.description:
We believe that World Youth Day 2022 should take place in Britain, with the main events and closing Mass in London. And we'll be there! Visit and LIKE the WYD London 2022 page here to support the cause:
https://www.facebook.com/WYDLondon2022?hc_location=stream

We could put on the best WYD there has ever been. Why? Because of the faith and energy of young Catholics here, the sense of renewal and hope within the Catholic Church in this country, the pull of the English language, and the attraction of Britain as a destination for visitors. WYD 2016 will be in Krakow; WYD 2019 will probably be outside Europe; and so by 2022 it will be time to come to Britain! It seems like a long way off, but time passes quickly, and it will take a lot of planning ahead.

WYD London would revitalise the Church and be an incredible witness to the people of this country. It would be a truly national event, bringing together every Catholic diocese, parish, group and movement. It wouldn't distract from other important pastoral priorities - instead it would provide a focus and stimulus for them. The period of planning and preparation would galvanise the Church at national and local levels. The ‘Days in the Dioceses', in the week before WYD itself, would be a celebration of faith throughout the regions, with hundreds of thousands of international young pilgrims welcomed into parishes and families across Britain. And there could be an important ecumenical dimension too, with Catholics and other Christian communities cooperating in hospitality, witness and celebration.

London would be the focus for the main WYD events and closing Mass. Why? Not because of some unthinking ‘London-centric’ prejudice in favour of the capital, but simply because of the practical advantages. London has the venues, the infrastructure, the transport, the public spaces - the sheer size; and it will have the experience of dealing with the Olympics. In the three dioceses that converge there (Westminster, Southwark and Brentwood), it has the greatest number of Catholic parishes and movements, the richest concentration of Catholic life, and an incomparable diversity of people and communities. And it has a unique pull in the international imagination. It would be ‘London uniting the country and opening out to the world’, rather than ‘London excluding the regions’.

Yes, there would be significant costs. But unlike Pope Benedict's visit to the UK in 2010, WYD would pay for itself. If just half a million pilgrims register (a conservative estimate), and the fee is just £50, that's £25m to start with, even before the serious fundraising has begun. And despite the misgivings of some, no-one seriously doubts that this kind of event brings massive economic benefits to the host country. The Papal visit, for example, brought an £8.5m boost to Glasgow alone; and a £12.5m boost to Birmingham. According to an independent report from PricewaterhouseCoopers, WYD Madrid brought 354m Euros to Spain, and there are similar predictions for Rio [see links below]. This is one reason why the British Government and Mayor of London will surely be interested in it. But there would be deeper reasons are well: the opportunity of hosting what is perhaps the largest youth event in the world, of opening our doors to people from every corner of the earth, and of putting young people at the centre of the national agenda.

At the moment, this is an off-the-cuff, un-thought-out, testing-the-water kind of proposition. It began in the parks and cafes of Madrid at WYD 2011, when thousands of young people from the UK began to think ‘We could do this!’ It continued in a World Youth Day London 2016 Facebook Event, before Krakow was announced, which had 2,900 potential attendees - it's now been closed! And it continues now through this new WYD London 2022 Event.

So if you want to see it move forward, INVITE YOUR FRIENDS - TODAY!! 

What do you think? Post your own comments, suggestions, criticisms, links, etc. in the box below.

You can see the Krakow page here:
https://www.facebook.com/pages/World-Youth-Day-Krakow-2016/1398183080399598

Report about effects of Papal visit on Glasgow's economy:
http://www.heraldscotland.com/news/home-news/papal-visit-s-8-5m-boost-for-city-1.1043610

Report about the effects of Papal visit on Birmingham's economy:
http://www.birminghampost.net/news/west-midlands-news/2010/09/08/pope-s-visit-expected-to-be-worth-12-5m-to-birmingham-s-economy-65233-27222221/

Report about the economic benefits of WYD Madrid to Spain:
http://www.rio2013.com/en/noticias/detalhes/144/wyd-madrid-yielded-354-million-euros

Report about the expected economic benefits of WYD to Rio: http://www.catholicnewsagency.com/news/world-youth-day-expected-to-boost-economy-in-rio-de-janeiro/

1049682325117214.loc_name: Pro-Intersectional Vegan Conference at VegfestUK London 2016
1049682325117214.description:
VegfestUK are thrilled to announce the first Pro-Intersectional Vegan Conference, to be held in the UK, at London in October, with a number of leading global pro-intersectional speakers already confirmed.

The conference will be aiming to look at a number of issues and topics, including an introduction to the concept of pro-intersectionality, how the concept originated, as well as questions such as
 
- How “easy” is it actually to be vegan?
 
- Does veganism have the image of belonging to privileged groups only?
 
- How do multiple forms of oppression entangle and manifest for marginalised social groups?
 
- What are the barriers facing some communities to go vegan?
 
These are topics of intense interest in the year when VegfestUK, organisers of some of Europe's top vegan festivals right now, are staging an inaugural Pro-Intersectional Vegan Conference, with a number of speakers from various social groups discussing these subjects with a wide audience.

See full list of speakers and schedules here - www.london.vegfest.co.uk/intersectional

The organisers of VegfestUK added:

“We're privileged to be hosting what we believe to be the UK's first-ever Pro-intersectional Vegan Conference. Our events have always been very inclusive and we’re lucky to live and work in some really tolerant and evolved communities in the UK. We found our understanding of pro-intersectionality to be a really useful concept in helping join the dots between different forms of oppression and privilege. We’re very happy as an event to host such a wide diversity of hugely talented and influential speakers from around the globe.”

The Pro-intersectional Vegan Conference takes place on the Sunday part of VegfestUK London, which returns to Olympia London in its 4th year in 2016. Other features at the show include: a Vegan Athletes Summit on the Saturday, a Health Summit, an Activists Summit, standup comedy, on top of 250 stalls, 18 caterers, kids activities, a Teen Zone, a Mature Zone and music to create a truly inclusive and vibrant experience for all.

Advance tickets to the whole VegfestUK event are available for purchase here: www.london.vegfest.co.uk/ticket-info

Conference weblink: www.london.vegfest.co.uk/intersectional

Conference Hashtag: #PIVC2016

319005978491091.loc_name: CUCCIOLE LASCIATE AL CANILE DA LI' NON SAREBBERO PIU' USCITE.....VIVE..
319005978491091.description:
PALERMO 19/09
Lunedì scorso mi reco al canile municipale di Palermo, per recuperare 2 gattini, di cui una paralizzata, uno zampetta in cancrena dove non sarebbero sopravvissuti.....vedo una signora con queste 2 cucciole, li avevano abbandonate nel loro giardino. ...le accarezzo la signora mi dice che visto quello che c'era al canile di cani, stava facendo richiesta di adozione.
Io recupero i miei cuccioli e vado via....
Ma l'indomani la volontaria mi dice.... le cagnoline non sono state più adottate, quindi dentro al canile rischiano che muoiono di gastroenterite oppure malattie infettive, in quanto troppo piccole .....
Bene io non ho fatto sonni tranquilli,  le cagnoline le ho viste, toccate, coccolate, non potevo prendermi carico, avendo 35 gattini di cui mi occupo, dove i miei sonni non sono più tranquilli per i debiti. ...
Ma per queste creature ho stretto le spalle, e allora eccole qua'.....al momento sono ricoverate, faremo accertamenti e cercheremo adozione. ...
Un ANGELO MERAVIGLIOSO per le cucciole provvederà a i costi della pensione GRAZIE ANGELO. ..le piccole avranno bisogno essere aiutare per compensare costi ricovero e quello che necessitano....

728853707214311.description:
The Big Animal Rights March is a mass march happening on October 29th 2016 in London. Animal rights marches have happened before and there are vegan protests often in London but nothing before has happened on a big enough scale. 

Marches have helped rights campaigns throughout history and now it is the animals' turn to have their march for their rights. We want this march to be as large and historic as those which aided the campaigns for civil rights, gay rights, women's rights etc and for this to happen we must all participate, share the event and invite every vegan we know! Billions of animals are slaughtered, raped, tortured, mutilated and enslaved every year because their species is seen as inferior and it needs to stop. We ask vegans and animal rights enthusiasts of the world to come together in London on October 29th 2016 to finally bring the vegan movement the publicity it needs. 

Veganism has soared lately and has been publicised much more frequently and positively than before and when people see thousands and thousands of us marching through London next year it could be the step this movement needs. But this needs to be big, it needs to be historic. We want this to be the most important event in the history of animal rights and we need you all to join in to make that happen.

Spread the word, share the event, tell everybody you know, the vegans are coming to London and they will not stand for the oppression of animals any longer. Animals can't march for their liberation, let's do the marching for them. See you all on October 29th.

This march is being organised with the help of Surge.

Following a 4 star two-week run at the Edinburgh Fringe, Howie the Rookie is coming to Cambridge:

'Someone's after you, you're hunted.' 

Meet Howie Lee and Rookie Lee, two young men with nothing in common but a last name and a destructive instinct.

 Set in the ‘badland’ suburbs of 1990s Dublin, Mark O’Rowe’s critically acclaimed two-hander is a visceral tragedy with surprising comic twists. 

“Actors Tom Taplin and Ed Limb tackle O’Rowe’s monologues to an incredibly high standard, simultaneously portraying both the powerful, violent energy and the intense depth of emotion written into O’Rowe’s poetic, unrelenting verse.” ★★★★ThreeWeeks Edinburgh

“With superb acting and a phenomenal script, it's a show that will certainly entertain.” Broadway Baby

260979424268490.description:
Since the launch party in February, Sweet Revenge!!! has been quietly building a reputation for its friendly, fun and inclusive atmosphere and a playlist that mixes old and new DIY & indiepop with indie disco floor fillers. We’re excited to announce our first festival - the Cambridge Indiepop All-dayer!

We're bringing some of our favourite DIY and indiepop bands to the Blue Moon on Saturday 12 November 2016. 

The Spook School (http:..www.fb.com/thespookschool) recently headlined the Indietracks festival in Derbyshire and we’re thrilled to be bringing them down from Edinburgh for their first Cambridge show! Their infectious punkish indiepop anthems include lyrics that explore gender, sexuality and identity and ridiculously catchy hooks! 

The self-titled debut from Fortuna Pop favourites Chorusgirl (http://www.chorusgirl.co.uk/) is crammed full of dreamy, guitar-driven pop songs reminiscent of The Cure and 80s and 90s 4AD legends like Lush and The Breeders. If you were lucky enough to catch their wonderful set when they were in town last year, you’ll know why we’re so excited to be bringing them back to the Blue Moon!

Two White Cranes (https://twowhitecranes.bandcamp.com/) is Roxy Brennan who you might have seen singing and playing things as part of Joanna Gruesome, Grubs, Towel and formerly of Trust Fund. As Two White Cranes, Roxy makes beautifully stripped down folk-tinged indiepop with a noisy edge.

Deerful (https://deerful.bandcamp.com/) is the electro pop solo project from multi-instrumentalist Emma Winston. Her recent EPs are filled with perfect pop songs that combine compelling storytelling with synth sounds and electronic beats. Her first album will be released in 2017.

Suggested Friends (https://www.facebook.com/suggestedfriends) are a jangly punkish pop band playing catchy songs about regret and micro-aggressions, featuring members of Wolf Girl and Actual Crimes. Melodic hooks, big choruses, and all the awkward banter you could want.

¡Ay Carmela! (https://www.facebook.com/aycarmelaband)
are a three-piece DIY band from West London who make jagged 90s-inspired indie punk with gorgeous, catchy vocals. Their debut album, Working Weeks, is out at the end of July.

In case you’ve been hiding under a rock, Mammoth Penguins (https://www.facebook.com/MammothPenguins) are Cambridge’s finest Indiepop three-piece! Emma, Mark and Tom have played in a million bands over the past 15 years, including Standard Fare, Pony Collaboration, Violet Woods and Puncture Repair Kit. They’ve built up a great live reputation, had a load of airplay on 6 Music and their debut album Hide and Seek was one of our favourite records of 2015!

Local heroes Baby Seals (https://www.facebook.com/thebabyseals/) have been building up a following in Cambridge over the last year with their noisy live shows and empowering, feminist pop punk songs. We love them!

Melge (https://melge.bandcamp.com/) write cerebral belters for wine nights and Wine Knights. Lovely pointy-punk synth tunes from Cambridge and London.

As we’ll be entertaining you all day, we’ll also be providing some tasty food options! The Blue Moon will be serving its amazing astronaut-themed pizzas all day and the award-winning Wandering Yak will also be setting up outside at tea-time. The Wandering Yak is a Cambridge streetfood truck specialising in meat-free Middle Eastern influenced food. A recent winner of the Cambridge Streetfood award 2016, The Yak will delight with variety, amazing flavours and lots of choice, especially in their Mezze boxes. 

Doors will open around 1.30 pm with bands starting soon after. After the bands finish, we'll be having a Sweet Revenge!!! indie disco until late. Dancing is included in the ticket price!

Advance tickets are available for £12 at We Got Tickets. If we have any tickets left on the day, they’ll be available on the door for £15.

**Tickets**

£17 Standard - skiddle.com/e/12802039 

If our event falls on your birthday weekend, we'll make it extra special by giving you and a guest free entry. Just send us an email to info@trancesanctuary.com 

**Event Info**
Kearnage Recordings was created by Bryan in 2010 and has since gone on to become one of the most respected labels within the Trance scene. This success has paved the way for Kearnage events to be staged across the world in cities such as Sydney, Melbourne, Dublin, Glasgow and Manchester. So we are very pleased that Bryan has chosen Trance Sanctuary to host it's first ever Kearnage event here in London. 

Bryan last played in the capital in March 2015 at our 4th Birthday and he has always been a popular guest at TS. So we are very much looking forward to his highly anticipated return. 

Joining the Irishman behind the decks will be a number of special guests as well as DJ/Producers from the label.

We're delighted to announce that the annual Cambridge IV is back! 

The Cambridge IV is one of the most prestigious and competitive debate tournaments, both within IONA and globally. It has traditionally been characterised by outstanding judging, top-notch debates and superb socials - this year is no exception.

The tournament will take place on 18 and 19 November. International arrivals will be on 17 November.

The team cap has been expanded to 120 teams. Registration fees are £85 and £100 for IONA (the UK and Ireland) and non-IONA teams respectively. N-1 applies for judging, but institutions are welcome to register more judges.

Registration for non-IONA institutions and independent adjudicators will begin at 12pm BST on 25 July. Registration for IONA institutions will begin at 12pm BST on 9 August.

456703734525595.description:
Welcome to the event page for the Cambridge Women's open. 
Cambridge Women's will be 4 rounds of 5 minute speeches with a break to semi-finals. We are also hoping to have a break to ESL and Novice finals depending on how many teams reg.
N-1 applies to all institutional teams. We would ask universities to preference judges who identify wholly or partially as women in selection, however all are welcome. All chair judges will identify wholly or partially as women and the same policy applies to the break. This also applies to independent judges

Schedule: 
9:00-9:30 Registration
9:30-10:00 Announcements
10.00-11.30 Round 1
11.30-13.00 Round 2
13.00-14.00 Lunch 
14.00-15.30 Round 3
15.30-17.00 Round 4
17.00-18:00 Dinner and Break Announcement 
18:00-19.30 Semi-Finals (and possible Novice/ESL Finals)
19.30-21:00 Finals
21.00 Social and Announcements/Awards

CAs: 
Bionda Merckens
Bionda is the convenor of Dutch WUDC 2017. She has been very active on the Dutch and the international circuit, both in judging and debating. At WUDC, she was an open quarter-finalist, an ESL top 10 speaker and breaking judge. Bionda has had similar success at EUDC, she has been an ESL quarterfinalist and an EUDC top 10 ESL speaker.

Gigi Gil 
Gigi has broken at over 25 competitions as a speaker and about 20 as a judge. This includes an ESL semi-final at WUDC 2016 and an ESL quarter-final at EUDC 2016, where she was also 6th best ESL speaker. She also broke as a judge at EUDC 2014. Gigi has won about 5 competitions, including Berlin IV 2016. She has been best speaker 4 times including Paris IV this year. She has already CA'ed over 10 competitions including Imperial IV and Dutch Nationals, and is going to CA KCL and Cork.

Evan Lynyak 
Evan was 7th best speaker at Thessaloniki WUDC and the 5th breaking team. In addition, she was the North American Universities champion and 7th best speaker, the Pan American Universities champion and top speaker and a US Universities Grand Finalist and 2nd speaker. Evan has judged the semifinals of the Yale IV, the open partial quarterfinals and the ESL semifinals at EUDC.

Sharmila Parmanand
Sharmila was CA of Berlin WUDC, Asian BP 2011, Austral-Asian Women's 2012 and US Nationals 2016. She was DCA of Australs in 2010 and 2011. She Judged WUDC Open Finals twice and Open Semifinals thee times. She also spoke in the Grand Final of Australs and WUDC Octofinals and is a three time Asian champion. Sharmila has also coached teams across 25 countries.

Any enquiries should be made to:
Katherine Dunbar and Lydia Day 
Convenors 
cambridgewomensopen@gmail.com

Eligibility: 
Speakers and judges should individually identify wholly or partially as women.

198181737234416.description:
Get ready Irreverent Warrirors are coming to Richland, Washington hosted by Caitlin Lee!

The 22 km hike, with a 22 kg pack, for the 22 vets a day who commit suicide is back! Thank you to all the veterans, civilian supporters, venues, and business owners that contributed to such an awesome success to last year's hike!

The mission of the Silkies Hike is to bring veterans together with laughter and camaraderie, create a support network for veterans, and provide a day of therapy in order to prevent veteran suicide. These hikes support and spread our bottom line: "put the gun back on safe, put it back on the nightstand, and stick around a bit longer."

The silkies hike combines some of the things Marines specifically love most in an effort to bring awareness to a serious issue: humor and very short shorts known as silkies.

The hike provides the therapy and treatment for veterans suffering from post traumatic stress and other stressors to effectively prevent suicide by using humor and camaraderie to heal mental wounds.

WHAT:
A 22km (13.6 mile) hike with 22 kg (optional) on our backs in silkies (optional) for military past and present.

WHY:
To get our veterans together, to put weight on our backs, to feel nostalgic, to laugh, to bond and to remind us all that our camaraderie, brotherhood and sisterhood will never die.

WHEN
Step off at:
TBA

WHERE :
TBA


Civilians:
Please meet us for the initial festivities and also advance to the locations if you'd like to receive your veterans with cheers, hugs, kisses, photos, videos, screaming, yelling, and excessive PDA.

UOD:
Marines:
Green/Black silkies
Body/face paint
Desert/combat boots.

Sailors:
Green/blue/black silkies
Body/face paint
Desert/combat boots

Soldiers:
Green/black silkies
Body/face paint
Banana hammocks
Body/face paint
Desert/combat boots
You can leave the gay reflective army belts at home...oh and the berets too.

Airmen:
Green/blue/black/pink silkies
Body/face paint
Desert/combat boots...remember there is no air conditioning during the march because it's happening "outside" lol.

Coasties:
Turqoise/aquamarine/pink silkies with dolphin caricatures
Body/face paint
Desert/combat boots
Prepare to hear Coastie jokes from your Navy brethren for the entirety of the march.

GEAR LIST:
Backpack - The 22 kg is optional
Snacks - Nuts, bars, food that will fuel you throughout the day
Camelback with water
Sunblock
Headgear - hat, kevlar
Eye Pro - Sunglasses, goggles
Vaseline and Mulskin
Tennis shoes and shower shoes
Extra socks
Extra shirt
Hoodie
Tylenol..er motrin..but seriously Tylenol for the hangover.

TRANSPORTATION AND SAFETY:

LEGAL STUFF:

Dont bring any weapons, weapon accessories, magazines, ammo, flash bangs, grenades, nuclear devices, WMDs or other illegal arms.
We will be going into public venues, so even if you are licensed for concealed carry - leave it.

Public drinking is illegal - there we said it.

To avoid throat punching liberal hippies please try to avoid engaging people in matters about politics, and the military that will end in us getting kicked out and arrested.

DOs:

Do "check-in" on Facebook as we progress through the hike.
Do FLIRT with girls and invite them to the after party later that night.
Do whatever it takes to help a fellow vet out
Do mumble the words "I love you" to a bunch of dudes/dudettes you've never met.
DO bring moto shirts and everything you own that is red, white, and blue.

RECOMMENDATIONS:

For machine gunners - Make something that mimics the weight of a 240 golf on your back and we'll pass it around.

For Corpsmen and Medics - rig an IV bag with a beverage you can pass around.

Bring your guidons, your American flags, your service branch flags and your moto voice for cadences.

MORE ABOUT US:

The Silkies Hike is not about awareness, it's about prevention, because the connections and bonds that we make during the hike will become our support network for the rest of our lives. In order to prevent suicides, we have to support each other. This hike facilitates veterans bonding, connecting, and supporting each other.

If you would like to help us prevent veteran suicides through our veterans therapeutic events and entertainment, please donate to the Non-profit, Irreverent Warriors Inc. via www.irreverentwarriors.com/donate to donate using paypal. We are incredibly grateful for your donations and support, and we will express our gratitude by using your money to keep veterans alive and well. They are a California based public charity, with 501(c)3 tax exemption. Your donations are tax deductible and the tax ID number is 47-4789126.

Please message me if you have questions or if I'm forgetting anything.

Semper Fi.

215751105428019.loc_name: Mittelaltermarkt und historisches Handwerk - Markt der Vielfalt Bremgarten (AG)
215751105428019.description:
Der Markt der Vielfalt besticht durch sein grosses Angebot mit unterschiedlichen Themenbereichen und dem besonderen Charme der Bremgarter Altstadt. Vielfalt, weil er folgende Bereiche beinhaltet:

- Historisches Handwerk in den hinteren Gassen der oberen Altstadt mit über 70 Teilnehmern
- Mittelaltermarkt auf dem Casinoplatz, dem Schulhausplatz von der Stiftung Josef und dem Platz bei der Kapuzinerkirche
- Traditionellen Jahrmarkt mit zirka 200 Ständen in der Marktgasse und auf dem Schulhausplatz
- Antiquitätenmarkt im Casino und auf der Badstrasse
- Oldtimer-Autos auf dem Postplatz

996259493804760.description:
The government is waging war on students and our education.

Colleges have been cut to the core, with huge job losses and course closures. 

Tuition fees are rising and the government is forcing universities to run like businesses.
 
Students are facing higher debt than ever before with maintenance grants and NHS bursaries scrapped, student loan terms changed and tuition fees set to reach £12,000 by 2026.

The government has ignored students and staff for too long – this has to stop.

Students – let’s march in our thousands and show the government we will not be ignored.

Alongside our staff, we have the power to halt cuts and stop fees rising even more.

Together we are a force too large to ignore.

Will YOU join NUS and UCU on Saturday November 19th and march? 

We are United for Education. 

#Demo #Nov19

280930278914217.description:
LIVE: 

DUPLICATE (Mental Drop rec/Stompfmaschin) IT 

HELBER GUN (24/7 Records)  MEX 

KULARIS (Spin Twist rec) DE 

LIFEFORMS (Iono) ISR 

PRAYING MANTIS  (Psybox) AUT

STIVELIX (Mental Drop rec) IT  


DJs: 

BENSENSE  (Psybox/Amanita) AUT

CAROLA   (Question of Prog)  CH 

CINARA  (Psyence rec.) AUT



LINE UP CLOSED....


Dekoration:  VISION SCIENTISTS

Visuals: RESORB 


Wir freuen uns sehr auch diesmal mit euch in der Music Hall Innsbruck feiern zu können  <3  

DUPLICATE aus Italien ist ein frisches und junges Projekt aus dem Hause Mental Drop. Verträumter Offbeat ist angesagt.

HELBER GUN aus Mexiko sind weltweit bekannt für ihre einzigartigen und mitreißenden Sounds...psychedelische Töne und fette Bässe sind garantiert.

KULARIS  dürfte wohl jedem Liebhaber der progressiven Töne ein Begriff sein....wir freuen uns auf sein Set.

LIFEFORMS aus Israel wird uns mit seinem Set die Nacht versüssen. Psychedelische Sounds und hämmernde Beats sind Programm.

PRAYING MANTIS aus Innsbruck wird für uns ein Tribal Trance Set spielen. Pumpende Basslines und sphärische Melodien erwarten uns.

STIVELIX aus dem schönen Südtirol ist in Innsbruck kein unbeschriebenes Blatt.... Er wird uns mit einem sphärischen und doch treibendem Offbeat Set verwöhnen.

BENSENSE wird uns diesmal ein knackiges Psy to Prog Dj Set spielen 

CAROLA reist aus der Schweiz an um uns auf eine kleine  Reise durch den Progressive mitzunehmen.

CINARA wird für uns ein zügiges Psyset zum besten geben. 

VISION SCIENTISTS ist ein Gemeinschaftsprojekt von PSYPIX und BUJU DECORATION. Sie werden die Music Hall wieder zusammen in eine Wunderwelt verwandeln. Optischer Genuß der Sonderklasse erwartet uns.
Zusammen mit dem fantastischem Mapping von RESORB entsteht ein einzigartiges Dekorationskonzept. 

Abendkasse: tba 

Einlass: ab 18 Jahren

Africa on the Square returns to Trafalgar Square for the third time on Saturday 15 October. 

This popular event celebrates African arts and culture, with activities  that highlight communities from across the continent. You can expect a fantastic line-up of entertainment on the day including live music, DJs, dancing and a talent show. Plus an African market, food stalls, fashion show and lots of fun stuff for kids. 

Africa on the Square is organised by the Mayor of London for Black History Month 2016. Africa on the Square is supported by Lebara, Air France and The Voice and our programme partner Open The Gate.

This is a free event.

For more information visit: http://www.london.gov.uk/africa

1202871023098501.description:
PICK & MIX FROM 1000’S OF MENS AND WOMENS VINTAGE ITEMS – BUY YOUR VINTAGE BY WEIGHT – PAY ONLY £15 PER KILO 

On Saturday 15th October the only way to shop retro returns to The London Irish Centre in Camden!

Earlybird Public Entry: 11:00am, £3 admission payable on the door
General Public Entry: 12pm, £1.50 admission payable on the door

The Vintage Clothing Kilo Sale is a collaboration between Glass Onion, Europe's largest vintage wholesaler and us, one of Britain's biggest vintage fairs. We'll be bringing over 5 TONNES of retro fashion for you to snap up at the unbelievably cheap price of £15.00 per kilo. You simply select any items you like, take them to the weigh station and pay for the weight of the clothes you want.

So, what on earth are we banging on about? Well, here are a few very good reasons to cancel your plans...

1) IT'S EXCLUSIVE! Ran by us boffins at Judy's Affordable Vintage Fair, we partner up with Europe's BIGGEST vintage wholesaler to bring you 5 TONNES of stock! Laid out before you and waiting to be shopped, we're talking everything from retro tees to denim, jackets to jumpers to shorts and skirts. Featuring ladies and gents fashion and accessories from the 1970s onwards, we don't disappoint.

2) It's SO FRIKKIN' CHEAP! After trying on, parading and hoarding your items, take them to our weighing desk where you will be charged a meagre £15 A KILO! So roughly what does a kilo equal? Naturally it depends on the fabric and style, but it could be...

Jeans and a Jumper
A jumper, t shirt and shorts
A dress and a heavy cardigan
A dress, a shawl and a bag
Four light summer dresses
Two shirts and a pair of trousers

No better place to shop affordable vintage in a BIG way, come get a new wardrobe and still have some change left over. Even better, we take CASH AND CARD once you've paid your entry fee.

One final thing to get you going? Because everyone likes an offer, we're thrilled to say that IF YOU BUY 10 KILOS OR MORE, THE PRICE DROPS FROM £15 A KILO TO £10 A KILO! If that's not madness, we don't know what is!

And there we have it folks - ample reasons to practically CAMP outside and wait for the goodies [not really. Well, you can if you want!]

For any TRADERS wanting to come and shop for your business, email jenessa@vintagekilosale.co.uk and request your trade forms. BLOGGERS and PRESS can also contact us using this address.

Please note that all sales are final and items cannot be returned, swapped or re-weighed after payment has been taken.


Retro Regards,
Team Kilo x

641711315985826.loc_name: Shades of the City - London's Ghosts
641711315985826.description:
A Salon in the Cemetery on London's Ghosts: What Lies Beneath and Haunted London with Alan Brooke and Alan Murdie

The London Underground late at night has an eerie atmosphere with its labyrinth of subterranean tunnels and passages, abandoned stations and rumours of disturbed burial grounds and other disruptions to the subterranean fabric of this ancient city. Workers and passengers on the Underground have regularly reported unexplained incidents, including the sightings of the ghost of an actress who is regularly witnessed on Aldywch Station and the "Black Nun" at Bank Station. Eerie noises, such as the cries of 13 year-old Anne Naylor, who was murdered in 1758 at Farringdon Station, and the screams of children who were among the 173 people who were crushed to death in the London Underground’s worst ever accident at Bethnal Green Station during World War II, are still heard echoing down the years. ALAN BROOKE will delve into these and other uncanny underground occurrences.

Ghostbuster ALAN MURDIE will examine the legends surrounding some of London’s most famous supposedly haunted locations, ranging from a prison, a stately mansion, a court house and a West End cinema. What can we deduce about the nature of paranormal experiences and when they are most likely to happen? At a time where reportedly the average Briton is more likely to believe in ghosts than in God how is the evidence stacking up?

Alan will also dispense practical tips for those wishing to embark on their own ghost hunting expeditions, stressing that the main item to keep with you at all times is an open mind.

Each ticket includes a delightful gin cocktail and a 20% donation towards a host of restoration projects at Brompton Cemetery.

Speakers include:

Alan Brooke
Alan Brooke has over twenty years experience as a history lecturer to Higher Education level. He has co-authored five books about London’s history, including London; City of the Dead due to be published this year by The History Press.

Alan Murdie
Alan Murdie is a barrister by trade and also the chair of the Spontaneous Phenomena Committee for the Society for Psychical Research. He has investigated numerous cases of ghosts and poltergeists and has written and broadcast extensively on psychic topics. He was chairman of the Ghost Club, compiles the monthly “Ghostwatch” column for the Fortean Times and is the author of a number of books on hauntings around the UK.

1752208068401928.description:
In the 7th century BC, the Spartans wanted to produce the strongest and most mentally tough citizens on earth. To do this, they created the Agoge, a system of training that became the envy of the known world.
 
 To complete the Spartan Agoge, one overcomes mental and physical obstacles that aim to develop the body, mind and spirit. Most people will need to undertake months of training and self-discovery to earn this coveted achievement.
 
 It is advised that entrants have completed various endurance events and intellectual challenges. For example: a participant may have developed perseverance, camaraderie, and leadership training through the military, or by completing various Spartan Races and Spartan Hurricane Heat distances.
 
The Spartan Agoge is the culmination of every physical and mental strength as well as everything a person has learned in life. Finishers become innovative thinkers, prudent risk-takers, and expert decision-makers. They will embody the Spartan Code, a code of honor and respect that breeds trust and inspires action. Most importantly, they become masters of themselves.

NYC producer, josh pan, has already put out more music in the past month than many of your favorite artists did in all of 2014. The rising artist has harnessed the power of Soundcloud to share his art with the world, self-releasing track after track without sacrificing one iota of quality. From Hip Hop inspired beats like “touch the sky” and “Bubble” to the laid-back lounge vibes of “rock with you“, Josh’s musical output is creatively expansive, leading a handful of fans on social platforms to quasi-jokingly refer to him as the next Diplo. Is there some truth to that? We’ll know in time. But one thing is for certain, josh pan’s ever-growing catalog of impressive music is making a valid case for a success story in the making.

Η Νατάσσα επιστρέφει στο Λονδίνο - με την ολοκαίνουρια 'Βαβέλ' σε έναν από τους πιο υπέροχους χώρους της πόλης - το KOKO στο Camden. Όπως δεν την έχετε ξαναδεί! 

Η Νατάσσα Μποφίλιου αποτελεί για πολλούς τη σημαντικότερη Ελληνίδα ερμηνεύτρια της νέας γενιάς. Μέσα σε μια μόλις δεκαετία κατόρθωσε να λάμψει σε σκηνές και θέατρα σε ολόκληρη την Ελλάδα, την Κύπρο αλλά και την υπόλοιπη Ευρώπη, ταυτίζοντας το όνομα της με την πληθωρικότητα, το μεσογειακό πάθος, αλλά και την εσωτερικότητα. Το 2016 με τους μόνιμους συνεργάτες της Θέμη Καραμουρατίδη (Μουσική - ενορχηστρώσεις) και Γεράσιμο Ευαγγελάτο (Στίχοι - Καλλιτεχνική επιμέλεια) κυκλοφόρησαν το δίσκο Βαβέλ, ένα μωσαϊκό ήχων και χρωμάτων της χώρας τους και με την ομώνυμη παράσταση γύρισαν την Ελλάδα σε μια πολύ επιτυχημένη περιοδεία.

Αυτή η παράσταση, εμπλουτισμένη με τραγούδια που συμπληρώνουν το μουσικό πρόσωπο της κλασικής και σύγχρονης Ελλάδας αλλά και επιλογές από το διεθνές ρεπερτόριο, επισκέπτεται τo Λονδίνο για να συστήσει στο κοινό του Koko μια σπουδαία νέα ερμηνεύτρια που θα θυμούνται για καιρό.

Athens 2016. A city reborn from its ashes, shedding off illusions and certainties of the past, bidding farewell to old ideas and sailing towards uncharted territories.

“Babel”, a kaleidoscope of popular music from Greece and the Balkans, jazz, tales of people who fall in love, sink in pain and despair, get drunk, laugh their hearts out. 
A once-in-a-lifetime momentum, captured by three of the most talented artists of their generation: Natassa Bofiliou (vocals), Themis Karamouratidis (composition and instrumentation) and Gerasimos Evaggelatos (lyrics and artistic direction) in a new album and a dazzling, inspiring, revealing performance.

Come and meet Natassa, one of the most talented modern Greek singers, with a unique expressiveness and passion on stage, and her partners in crime, for a on-off performance this October at KOKO, and let them take you on a voyage without return.

* Standing only.

Tareq is a London-based Greek-Jordanian recording artist, who has been producing electronic music since 2005.  Tareq's debut solo album "Cocoon" was voted Best Electronic Album of the Year 2010 in his native Greece and included the hits "Cold", "Feel Me" and "Mosquito", with Mix Mag naming "Feel Me" feat Natassa Bofiliou (Mighty Mouse Remix) as their Tune of the Month for August 2011. Tareq's second album "Fish" embodies a different approach to pop music from his first album and includes successful collaborations with a number of Greek Indie Pop artists such as Natassa Bofiliou, Ilia Darlin, Marietta Fafouti and Marina Satti. In his theme of evolving his sound over time, Tareq's imminent release of his upcoming EP "Indigo" does not disappoint : A funky feast of intelligent smooth Electro-Pop vibes to transport any listener to another world.
