101507933634317.description:
Please read our "details" section to learn more about Take Back Democracy March
*Scroll down 


Funding page: 

https://www.gofundme.com/takebackdemocracy


We are making noise, but we are not being LOUD enough.
Democracy must be demanded!

"Take Back Democracy March on DC" is a nationwide event that anyone from any political party or leaning can get behind.  Our primary goal is to demand a government truly of, by and for the people.
We will achieve this by marching on our nations capital in Washington DC.

Our demands include: 
- Paper ballots
- Hand counting
- Independent audits
- Independent exit polls
- Campaign finance reform 
- United Nations election monitoring
- Election Fraud investigation
- Investigate and prosecute corruption
- Eliminate gerrymandering
- Imposing term limits on all elected offices
- Elimination of Electoral College

Please join us in letting our leaders know that WE THE PEOPLE aren't standing down and want Democracy as the basis of our government.

678167862332927.description:
1. Mystischer Halloween Mittelalter Markt Duisburg
Am Samstag von 11-22.00 und Sonntag von 11-19 Uhr verfällt Duisburg ( Dü-Neumühl, Holtener Str.221 ) zurück in die Zeit des Mittelalters---des mystischen Mittelalters. Mittelalterliches Markttreiben mit vielen Händlern, Musik und Gauklern. Versorger bieten Käsespätzle, Fleisch, Wildschweinwurst, Creps und vieles mehr. Bier, Wein, Met und reichlich anderes wird ebenfalls geboten!
Am Samstag abend wirds heiß bei einer Feuershow.
Ein Überraschungskonzert findet ebenfalls statt.
Für das Flair der mystischen Zeit sorgen Inquisitor und Herold Freiherr Roland zu Eberswalde  sowie  Dämonenjäger und Prangermönch Bruder Dickbert... Es wird euch fesseln...
So kommet herbei Ihr magischen und nichtmagischen Wesen und feiert mit uns in dieser mystischen Zeit ...

neumuehl@ars-westfalica.com

Erzählt euren Freunden von diesem Ereignis...nicht das Sie es verpassen und sich hinterher in traurige Kürbisse verwandeln...

Gesamtzeit ca 30 min.  
Busse fahren im Halbstundentakt

1692129854448735.description:
Diwali is one of the most celebrated and festive events of the Hindu religion. Also known as Naraka Chathurdasi, it commemorates the victory of Krishna over the Demon Narakasura.It also celebrates the return of the valiant Lord Rama after his conquest of Ravana, joyous villagers light oil candles-diyas-giving the holiday its name of "Deepavali," or "the festival of lights."


The goal of USC HSO's annual Diwali event is to provide a place for students, away from home or near, to join in the prayer and merriment of a shared culture. We welcome students from all backgrounds and religions to celebrate with us as we engage in a night of flavorful cuisine, diverse performances, and high-spirited fun. It's the brightest night of the semester!

1144145972273398.loc_name: Biologischer Baumwollanbau mit den Chukwuemeka Schwestern
1144145972273398.description:
Baumwolle steht für gute Hautverträglichkeit und hohen Tragekomfort und ist deshalb nach wie vor das weltweit führende Material in der Textilherstellung: Über 50 Prozent aller Textilien enthalten die weiße Faser. Dabei ist das Tragen von Baumwollprodukten nicht ganz unproblematisch. Denn beim Anbau werden Pestizide eingesetzt, das kann zu gesundheitlichen Schäden beim Tragen der Kleidung führen. Zudem verbraucht der Anbau der Naturfaser so viel Wasser wie alle Privathaushalte weltweit zusammen. Höhere Nachfrage aus den Schwellenländern – allen voran China – sorgen für darüber hinaus steigende Preise. 

Mit Ihrem Projekt "More Cotton-Less Racism" fangt man schon zum Schmunzeln an. Doch genau diesen Effekt nutzen die Chukwuemeka Schwestern um Ihre Botschaft in den Köpfen der Menschen zu gravieren. Sie werden euch Ihre naturschonenden Agrarmethoden näher brngen und über Ihre weltweiten Erfolge berichten.

Eintritt: Freiwillige Spende (Der Reinerlös fließt auf das Spendenkonto der Chukwuemeka Schwestern

Das wird wahrscheinlich eine der kontroversesten Events von und, jedoch distanzieren wir und ganz klar vom Rassismus.

1747021178845573.description:
O sambista mais popular do Brasil, Zeca Pagodinho, retorna à Londres depois de mais de uma década, para um show épico e exclusivo no Hammersmith Apollo.

Uma rara oportunidade para ver o Zeca no Reino Unido, num fantástico show. Imperdível!

#ZecaLondon2016

Brazil's most popular samba star and four time Latin Grammy award winner, Zeca Pagodinho returns to London for a first-time-in-a-decade exclusive performance backed by his spectacular band at the Hammersmith Apollo.

Chosen as the headline performer at the 2016 Rio Olympics opening ceremony and having performed in front of 1 million people in Rio for a NYE concert in Rio, Zeca Pagodinho is Brazil's fiesta frontman and with his carnaval inspired sound continues to embody the free, easygoing Carioca spirit.

This is a rare opportunity to see Zeca perform in the UK and as a certifiied samba superstar, the show promises a trip to the heart of Brazilian culture.

1802012090017360.loc_name: Silent disco at The Natural History Museum
1802012090017360.description:
Due to popular demand, we've brought back the super awesome After-School Club for Grown-Ups at the very same Natural History Museum you once visited as a child! This is your chance to unleash your inner child and enjoy the school trip of your dreams with all your favourite people but this time, at night! Ooooh, exciting.
For just £30, you can uncover little-known secrets about the museum on a late-night treasure hunt, see specimens and design your own dinosaur t-shirt from 7pm-10pm on Friday October 14, but if you really want to make the most of the night, you should 100% pounce on the £48 tickets that get you access to the amazing silent disco from 10pm-1am too. Silent disco only tickets are also available for £22. If it's anything like last time, it's going to be an instant sell-out so you better be among the first to put your hand up!

BUY TICKETS HERE:
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/after-school-club-for-grown-ups-at-the-natural-history-museum-tickets-27067466521

952016551592581.description:
This ferociously dark comedy follows the idiosyncratic members of a very broken family who refuse to surrender to neighborhood criminal elements and would-be crooked cops. Escape from Happiness is both a viciously funny satire and a moving meditation on forgiveness.

“It’s brisk and stimulating, guaranteed to shake you up, make you laugh and get you thinking, all at the same time.” —Toronto Star

Performance Dates & Times:

Thursday, October 20, at 7 p.m.
Friday, October 21, at 7 p.m.
Saturday, October 22, at 2:30 p.m.
Saturday, October 22, at 8 p.m.
Sunday, October 23, at 2:30 p.m.

Tickets purchased in person at the USC Ticket Office: students, $5; faculty and staff, $8; general public, $12. Tickets purchased by phone or online are $14.

Parking:
Discounted parking is available for $10. Please inform the gate officer you are attending a School of Dramatic Arts performance.

1192294730837995.description:
In celebration of International Archaeology Day - Oct. 15th, Persian Student Association (PSA) and American Institute of Archaeology (AIA) at Stanford Jointly Present:

5000 Years of Iranian Engineering 

[Movie Screening + Q&A with the writer, director, and producer, Dr. Farzin Rezaeian]

Venue: Bishop Auditorium, Stanford
Date/Time: Oct. 15th, 5:00 - 7:30 pm

About the Film:

This film gives viewers a stimulating glance into the big, bold and beautiful engineering masterpieces of Iran throughout 5000 years of its history. It is skillfully enhanced by exquisite images and filled with limpid quotations by renowned scholars. It truly comes alive with state-of-the-art computer-generated reconstructions of Iranian heritage in science and technology. The movie demonstrates not only the range but also the skill and virtuosity of the Iranian engineers.

About the Writer, Director, and Producer, Dr. Farzin Rezaeian:
 
Dr. Farzin Rezaeian is a world-renowned writer, director, and producer who has generated multiple works on Iran's civilization and arts. During the past 20 years, he has worked on research, compiling texts and directing documentary movies, some of which have been recognized by national and international awards.

This event is co-sponsored by Hamid and Christina Moghadam Program in Iranian Studies, Amercian Institute of Archaeology, Persian Student Association at Stanford and the Alumni Association of College of Engineering, University of Tehran.

1636931676621727.loc_name: Club CloseUp: Marsicans / Idle Frets / Shanghai Blues (w/ Jagermeister)
1636931676621727.description:
Club CloseUp (w/ Jagermeister) Presents:

Marsicans: Heading on their 'Absence' nationwide tour, we are thrilled to have the much talked about London stop of their tour. It'll be their biggest London headline to date and with the live reputation this band are quickly gaining, they're Hoxton headline for CloseUp is not to be missed. They've already hit Glasto this year amongst a host of other live shows.

Idle Frets: The Chester act have been slowly developing a nationwide extending fanbase, and play for CloseUp as part of a nationwide tour that see's them performing with Marsicans 3 times. Last single 'Aftershow' is not to be missed live. They'll no doubt be performing infront of a packed room at Club CloseUp.

Shanghai Blues: Hailing from East London Shanghai Blues are 4 piece Alternative Indie band bursting on to the scene. Their guitar driven sound is populated with unforgettable melodies and intense guitar hooks taking influence from the likes of The 1975, Mooseblood and Catfish & The Bottlemen. With their debut single RUN out on November 25th 2016, seeing them live is a must.

208344916201813.description:
Karla's Kreations Presents...

The 1st Annual Cruisin' the Water for Cancer

Sponsored by
Ghetto Fabulous MC-LA, Hogg Life MC-LA Chapter, Rare Pearls SC, and The National Lowrider Association 

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and You will NOT want to miss this Cruise as we take our Love and Passion for Wheels, combine them, and Cruise to Ensenada!!!!

We will Party for 3 days all the while raising funds to bring awareness to Breast Cancer

In 2015 we have lost an estimated 40,450 women in the U.S.  from breast cancer, though death rates have been decreasing since 1989. We have ALL lost someone close or know someone who has lost someone to this disease.

Your rate includes taxes, port charges, ALL Carnival Access PLUS entry to ALL Events and Private affairs with the group

* Pre turn-up and candlelight vigil remembering our loved ones we've lost, Thursday night Location in LA at Ghettofabulous

*Sunday Morning as the sun rises we will meet on the ship remembering those we have lost and celebrating our survivors

1731442527127715.description:
London’s new attraction, the Slide at the ArcelorMittal Orbit is coming to the Park this summer! Measuring 178m, the Slide will be the world’s tallest and longest slide. 

Opening on 24 June, the Slide will be open daily, you’ll be able to travel down the UK’s tallest public artwork through light and dark sections as London’s dramatic skyscape passes by. The Slide will twist and turn 12 times and then it will end with a 50 metre straight run to the ground. In the exhilarating 40-second trip, riders are expected to hit speeds of up to 15 miles per hour!

Tickets will sell out quickly, so don’t miss out. For more information about tickets please visit the ArcelorMittal Orbit website http://arcelormittalorbit.com/

573123482888549.description:
About Your Trip
See what being a DreamTrips Member is all about on this Welcome DreamTrip! Take a cable car ride and get a bird’s-eye view of China’s Great Wall. Then, marvel at the architecture of The National Stadium (known as the Bird’s Nest) and the outside of the National Aquatics Center (better known as the Water Cube) – a massive structure which houses five swimming pools and held 17,000 spectators during the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games. To top it all off, there will also be optional training available to help you get the most out of your membership.

China’s capital city integrates modern civilization and ancient tradition. Picturesque palaces, scenic valleys and the iconic Great Wall draw millions of visitors to Beijing every year.  

What's Included

    4 days and 3 nights at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.
    Featuring deluxe room accommodations with 1 king-size bed or 2 double beds,
    3 breakfasts, 1 lunch and 3 dinners.
    Full-day Beijing Great Wall tour.
    Local souvenir gift.
    An In-destination Support Specialist will be provided when 20 or more adults book this trip. Their goal is to ensure you have a great DreamTrips experience from landing to liftoff. They host a welcome reception on arrival day, attend scheduled activities throughout the trip, notify the group of itinerary updates and more.
    Your trip includes 2 airport transfers:
    December 25 at 10 a.m., noon, 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From Beijing Capital International Airport to the hotel.
    December 28 at 9 a.m., 11 a.m., 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From the hotel to Beijing Capital International Airport.
    To take advantage of round-trip airport transfers, you must provide your flight information to the DreamTrips Specialist no later than December 9. These transfers are available only for the airport(s) and dates listed above. Transfers will not be offered if the flight information is not received by the deadline and transfers at any other time will incur a separate charge. Air transportation is not included. The closest commercial airport is Beijing Capital International Airport (PEK).

Hotel Details
With its downtown location, Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall is within walking distance of the subway, and is a short drive from Tiananmen Square, the Silk Market and Forbidden City.

The hotel’s restaurants feature international cuisine, seafood buffets and more. Additional amenities include a fitness center, an indoor pool with whirlpool, a sauna and a two-story bar/lounge. Many rooms overlook the nearby Ming Dynasty City Wall.

Enjoy the hotel’s spacious rooms and trademark Revive bedding for a comfortable and relaxing stay at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.

Check-in: 2 p.m.
Check-out: noon.

Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall
7 Jian Guo Men South Avenue
Dongcheng District, Beijing
Beijing 100005, China

PERFORMANCES: 
Friday, October 21st, 5:30 PM
Saturday, October 22nd, 4:00 PM
Sunday, October 23rd, 4:00 PM
Friday, October 28th, 5:30 PM 
Sunday, October 30th, 4:00 PM

TICKETS: Premium Seating: $72 ($52 for Stanford faculty/staff/students with valid ID)
Regular Seating: $52 ($32 for Stanford faculty/staff/students with valid ID)

LOCATION: Visual and Performing Arts Center at De Anza College (read below for parking permit instructions) 

DESCRIPTION: A hadji sets out to sell his servant and buy in his place a young slave girl. On the way, they see a poet about to be beheaded; a young lover in search of a purloined beloved; and troubadours, their profession banned, desperate to bring joy and laughter to any face. In short, the world they see is all topsy-turvy.

Tarabnameh has its genealogy in the tradition of Takhte-Hozi plays—a tradition of popular plays, combining comedy and music, dance and poetry. Centuries of despotism have rendered this form bereft of content. In Tarabnameh, a play with a cast of thirty-seven actors, this ancient comic genre keeps its joyous ambiance but takes on new form and meaning, underscoring the possibilities of once forgotten traditions becoming rich, robust, and lively modern forms of theater.

This play is written and directed acclaimed Iranian playwright Bahram Beyzaie. The play is being performed in Persian. Only part 2 of this play is being performed. A written account of part 1 by Mr. Beyzaie will be available at Iranian-studies.stanford.edu shortly.

We are very pleased to announce that the acclaimed actress Shabnam Tolouei will be joining the cast of Tarabnameh for part 2!

Please note the run time for this performance is approximately 5 ½ hours which includes a 15 and a 30-minute intermission. Concessions will be available for purchase during intermission.

IMPORTANT: Iranian Studies is covering the cost of parking for Tarabnameh attendees at De Anza’s VPAC theater! Please visit the Will Call office at the theater after you park to get a pass for your car. If you do not get a pass from Will Call or do not purchase a pass from De Anza, you might get a parking ticket and Iranian Studies cannot be held responsible for this.

Sponsored by the Hamid and Christina Moghadam Program in Iranian Studies and the Stanford Festival of Iranian Arts.

Seating for this event is Reserved.

Tickets will not be available in person. Online sales will remain open up to one hour after the performance has begun.

Enzo Siffredi.

Creator and main man of Minimal Kids & Wired, inspired and driven by the piano of Paolo Conte, Brasens’s guitar and Berlin’s underground, Enzo regards himself as an outsider.

His aim is not to adapt musically to a stereotype label or style but to remain innovative and experimental, precisely maintaining the distinctive sound that makes Enzo Siffredi so recognisable.

2015 saw him make his debut on Defected Records with ‘Sometimes’ where he reached no.1 in the Deep House and no.3 overall on Beatport’s charts, no.1 on Traxsource as well as receiving worldwide support and appreciation including a WMC nomination.

So far this year Enzo has released EP’s on both Defected and Suara gaining continued support from major players in the electronic music scene including Carl Cox, Marco Carola, Claude Von Stroke, PanPot and many more.

carissimi questo cucciolo al momento si  trova al canile,  una volontaria sta' provvedendo a trovare una sistemazione migliore, mi chiede aiuto al momento almeno per 1 mese trovare stallo, io ho cercato, ma stallo niente. ..niente. ...niente  ...
Ma Pulcinella al momento in una gabbia necessita riabilitazione, ha bisogno un luogo familiare, tranquillo, dall'intervento dove necessariamente hanno dovuto amputare la sua zampa lui ancora non riesce a mettersi all'impiedi. ...
Per questo cucciolo chiedo aiuto dobbiamo raggiungere il prima possibile la cifra di almeno 100€ per assicurare un luogo sicuro e tranquillo dove avrà la possibilità di rimettersi sulle sue zampe. ...
Per Pulcinella non servono grandi cifre....poco poco l'uno diamo la possibilità di raggiungere un futuro migliore. ...
GRAZIE CHI NON ABBANDONERÀ  PULCINELLA ♡

123842131403807.description:
Toy Run® Overberg 2016 will be held on Sunday 27 November 2016

Bikers will gather at 4 points over the Overberg and will join to form a mass ride into the village of Stanford for a get together on the village green. There will be live music, Food and drinks. 

This year we will have many more Bedouin Tents as well as more Food and Drinks Stalls. 

Entry for the event will be Toys to be donated across the Overberg for distribution to the less fortunate kids in the area to make their Xmas a little brighter. 

Gathering point 1: Wimpy Hermanus. 8.00am to leave at 8.30am
Route: Hermanus to Caledon via the Hemel & Aarde Valley. 40km

Gathering point 2: Wimpy Caledon. 9.30am to leave at 10am
Route: Caledon to Stanford via Van Brakelstoor road. 53km
Here Route 2 and Route 4 will meet for the mass ride to Stanford

Gathering point 3: Wimpy Gansbaai. 8.00am to leave at 8.30am
Route: Gansbaai to Bredasdorp via Baardskeerdersbos. 78km

Gathering point 4: Wimpy Bredasdorp. 9.30am to leave at 10am
Route: Bredasdorp to Stanford via Van Brakelstoor road. 69km
Here route 4 and route 2 will meet for the mass ride to Stanford

For the scooters and farm bikes that want to join the mass ride, please meet at Van Brakelstoor at 10.30am. 24km

Thanks must go to Hermanus SMC, Scattered Links MC and Southern Legion MC for providing assistance on the route for all the eager Toy Run® Bikers!

1226685477383466.loc_name: Midnight Screening: Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them
1226685477383466.description:
We love a good midnight screening here at the Arts Picturehouse!  Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them is an all-new adventure returning us to the wizarding world created by J.K. Rowling. 

Academy Award winner Eddie Redmayne ( The Theory of Everything Movie) stars in the central role of wizarding world magizoologist Newt Scamander, under the direction of David Yates, who helmed the last four Harry Potter blockbusters. 

Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them opens in 1926 as Newt Scamander has just completed a global excursion to find and document an extraordinary array of magical creatures. Arriving in New York for a brief stopover, he might have come and gone without incident were it not for a No-Maj (American for Muggle) named Jacob, a misplaced magical case, and the escape of some of Newt’s fantastic beasts, which could spell trouble for both the wizarding and No-Maj worlds.

819949404777724.description:
About Your Trip
See what being a DreamTrips Member is all about on this Welcome DreamTrip! Take a cable car ride and get a bird’s-eye view of China’s Great Wall. Then, marvel at the architecture of The National Stadium (known as the Bird’s Nest) and the outside of the National Aquatics Center (better known as the Water Cube) – a massive structure which houses five swimming pools and held 17,000 spectators during the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games. To top it all off, there will also be optional training available to help you get the most out of your membership.

China’s capital city integrates modern civilization and ancient tradition. Picturesque palaces, scenic valleys and the iconic Great Wall draw millions of visitors to Beijing every year.  


What's Included
4 days and 3 nights at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.
Featuring deluxe room accommodations with 1 king-size bed or 2 double beds,
3 breakfasts, 1 lunch and 3 dinners.
Full-day Beijing Great Wall tour.
Local souvenir gift.

Your trip includes 2 airport transfers:
December 22 at 10 a.m., noon, 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From Beijing Capital International Airport to the hotel.
December 25 at 9 a.m., 11 a.m., 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From the hotel to Beijing Capital International Airport.

Air transportation is not included. The closest commercial airport is Beijing Capital International Airport (PEK).
 

Hotel Details
With its downtown location, Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall is within walking distance of the subway, and is a short drive from Tiananmen Square, the Silk Market and Forbidden City.

The hotel’s restaurants feature international cuisine, seafood buffets and more. Additional amenities include a fitness center, an indoor pool with whirlpool, a sauna and a two-story bar/lounge. Many rooms overlook the nearby Ming Dynasty City Wall. 

Enjoy the hotel’s spacious rooms and trademark Revive bedding for a comfortable and relaxing stay at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.

Check-in: 2 p.m.
Check-out: noon.

Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall 
7 Jian Guo Men South Avenue
Dongcheng District, Beijing
Beijing 100005, China

655524777957459.description:
Mondays get a bad rep being the start of the 'working week' and what not, but we thought it’s about time people had something to look forward to on the most dreaded day of the week. So we picked up the phone, called our homie Yasmin and our good friends down at XOYO and said ‘hey guys, let's start a party.’
Believe us when we say RIP to the weekend and that Monday’s will be back on the map.

If you're new to London, haven't been before or you’ve just been
chilling under a rock, XOYO is KING when it comes to the London party scene. Regularly hosting artists such as Disclosure, Skream, Benji B, Artwork, Eats Everything, Jackmaster and more, they will now be the home to your new favourite weekly get down, MONDAY MONDAY

574461289430746.loc_name: Cambridge Halloween Latin Party by L&J and Bachata Spice
574461289430746.description:
Hi guys!
Halloween time is behind the door and we have lot of good news for you all :D

On Friday 21st October, L&J (Leandro & Jessica) will hold this amazing Latin Party.  

Party will start at 8 pm with  a Bachata Class by our Special Guest "Angel Peinando" coming all the way from London. Peynao is one of the biggest Bachata promoters in the UK (BACHATA SPICE) and an amazing bachata teacher.

At 9pm will start the real party with our own dj David Whitford who will play the best Latin tracks, salsa, bachata, reggaeton, rumba, merengue, kizomba and more.

!!!! SPECIAL NEWS !!!!
> We will have Bachata Obsession team with us, who entertain you all with their new dance show.

> Angel Peinando is not coming only to do a bachata class, but to hold one his BACHATA SPICE COMPETITION exactly in Cambridge in our party!!!
The Competition is open all the students, no teachers or professinal dancers, so this means that you can feel free to partecipate and have fun. 
For more information please see this link: http://www.bachataspice.com/bachataSpiceAmateurChampionship.html

> Plus....during the night we will choose the BEST HALLOWEEN COSTUME who will win a great  prize!!!

We hope to see you all in this crazy party and have fun all together :D 
LET'S DO IT!!

PARTY PRICE 10 £ entrance!

547466705410796.description:
Die Stadt Blankenberg erstrahlt erneut im November für ein Wochenende in historischem Schein.
Mit der historischen Katharinenkirmes zu Stadt Blankenberg vom 18. – 20.11.2016 drehen die Veranstalter Zarorien e.V. und die Karnevalsfreunde zu Stadt Blankenberg zum nunmehr 14. Male die Zeit in der kleinsten Stadt Deutschlands zurück in das Jahr 1248. An allen drei Tagen können die Besucher wieder auf Zeitreise gehen und das Mittelalter mit allen fünf Sinnen erleben.

Der Markt öffnet am Freitag gegen 16:00 Uhr seine Tore und dauert offiziell bis 22:00 Uhr. Am Samstag beginnt das Spektakel gegen 10:00 Uhr und endet gegen 22:00 Uhr. Am Sonntag haben Besucher von 10:00 Uhr bis 18:00 Uhr Gelegenheit, den Markt zu erkunden. Es wird empfohlen, öffentliche Verkehrsmittel zur Anreise zu nutzen. Ein Shuttelbus-Service erleichtert den steilen Weg zur Burg.

332850077053659.loc_name: Sink, Spoilers and Werecats in Cambridge!
332850077053659.description:
A message from SINK:  "Right, we have just sorted out two more gigs for later this year. Why?
Well, Ed had some Sink t-shirts left over from the last gigs that he NEEDS to shift.
There were a lot of people who wanted to come to the last gigs, but couldn't make it.
We had originally wanted to play with Spoilers at the June gigs, but they had prior bookings.
On top of all that, we had a ton of fun at those last 2 gigs, so when DS asked us to play Cambridge, we thought it through and decided to go for it and also add a London gig so that we could make a weekend of it.

...but it's mainly about selling those damn t-shirts (they'll be cheap) :-)

Friday 11th November at The Cornerhouse, Cambridge
Saturday 12th November at The Islington (Angel Tube), London

The bill for both nights will be Sink with Spoilers and Werecats.

Flyers and FB Events to follow.
And it's Paul Birthday on the 11th and he felt left out with Ed getting all the attention last time

205918389765112.description:
███████████████████████

FM4 Indiekiste mit Placebo
’20 Years of Placebo’ 
Support: The Joy Formidable
13.11.2016, Wiener Stadthalle 

███████████████████████

Placebo will be heading out on a world tour in October to celebrate the 20th Anniversary of the release of their platinum selling debut album ’Placebo’. 

The first leg of the ’20 Years of Placebo’ tour kicks off in Denmark on October 13th 2016 and runs through to Wembley Arena in London on December 15th 2016.  Further dates for 2017 will be revealed later.

The Band Promise a set list spanning their whole back catalogue. Brian Molko teased…

“Let's just say there will be songs in the set that I've sworn never to play again. I think it's time that we purposefully acknowledged what a lot of Placebo fans really want to hear. They've been very patient with us since we rarely play our most commercially successful material.  A 20 year anniversary tour seems like the right time to do so. That's our intention. This tour is very much for the fans and a chance for us to revisit a lot of our early material. So, if you want to see us play songs like 'Pure Morning’ and 'Nancy Boy’ which we haven't played in almost ten years and may not play again, then you'd better come along to these shows! We'll have some surprises in there too." 

███████████████████████

Edwartainments & Cambridge Junction proudly present 
THE MOUSE OUTFIT

Friday 2nd December 2016 
Cambridge Junction, Clifton Way, Cambridge Leisure Park, CB1 7GX, UK
£13.50 (inc. £1.50 cmsn)
www.junction.co.uk/the-mouse-outfit
Doors 7pm

Info & Box office: 01223 511 511

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

The Mouse Outfit is a 9 piece live band and production team centred around Chini (keys), Pitch (percussion/MPC) and Defty (bass). Their acclaimed debut album won UK hip hop album of the year 2013 (Wordplay Magazine) and was ranked in ABC News’ top 50 albums of 2013. Since the release of ‘Escape Music’ (which is now available on double vinyl through HHV.DE), their profile has increased significantly, both within the UK and internationally. The album featured many of Manchester’s most talented MCs, but the live show is fronted by UK hip hop legend Dr Syntax and verbal acrobat Sparkz. A horn heavy and funk driven live show combines original material with medleys of classic hip hop and bboy breaks, which has lead the band to be a firm favourite at festivals and clubs throughout the UK.

Earlier in their career they built a loyal fan base supporting many of the world’s finest hip hop acts including Chali 2na, Souls Of Mischief, Akil the MC and The Sugarhill Gang. Their reputation as a high quality live act resulted in two invitations to perform at the BBC’s legendary Maida Vale Studios in London. 2014 saw the band take their brand of funk, jazz and reggae influenced hip hop to France, Germany, Italy, Hungary, Czech Republic and Croatia, with key slots at prestigious festivals such as Soundwave, Outlook and Fusion.


www.themouseoutfit.com
www.facebook.com/themouseoutfit
https://twitter.com/themouseoutfit
https://soundcloud.com/themouseoutfit

1202560156444826.description:
About Your Trip
See what being a DreamTrips Member is all about on this Welcome DreamTrip! Take a cable car ride and get a bird’s-eye view of China’s Great Wall. Then, marvel at the architecture of The National Stadium (known as the Bird’s Nest) and the outside of the National Aquatics Center (better known as the Water Cube) – a massive structure which houses five swimming pools and held 17,000 spectators during the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games. To top it all off, there will also be optional training available to help you get the most out of your membership.

China’s capital city integrates modern civilization and ancient tradition. Picturesque palaces, scenic valleys and the iconic Great Wall draw millions of visitors to Beijing every year.  

What's Included

    4 days and 3 nights at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.
    Featuring deluxe room accommodations with 1 king-size bed or 2 double beds,
    3 breakfasts, 1 lunch and 3 dinners.
    Full-day Beijing Great Wall tour.
    Local souvenir gift.
    An In-destination Support Specialist will be provided when 20 or more adults book this trip. Their goal is to ensure you have a great DreamTrips experience from landing to liftoff. They host a welcome reception on arrival day, attend scheduled activities throughout the trip, notify the group of itinerary updates and more.
    Your trip includes 2 airport transfers:
    November 10at 10 a.m., noon, 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From Beijing Capital International Airport to the hotel.
    November 13 at 9 a.m., 11 a.m., 2 p.m. or 4 p.m.: From the hotel to Beijing Capital International Airport.
    To take advantage of round-trip airport transfers, you must provide your flight information to the DreamTrips Specialist no later than October 27. These transfers are available only for the airport(s) and dates listed above. Transfers will not be offered if the flight information is not received by the deadline and transfers at any other time will incur a separate charge. Air transportation is not included. The closest commercial airport is Beijing Capital International Airport (PEK).

Hotel Details
With its downtown location, Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall is within walking distance of the subway, and is a short drive from Tiananmen Square, the Silk Market and Forbidden City.

The hotel’s restaurants feature international cuisine, seafood buffets and more. Additional amenities include a fitness center, an indoor pool with whirlpool, a sauna and a two-story bar/lounge. Many rooms overlook the nearby Ming Dynasty City Wall.

Enjoy the hotel’s spacious rooms and trademark Revive bedding for a comfortable and relaxing stay at Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall.

Check-in: 2 p.m.
Check-out: noon.

Beijing Marriott Hotel City Wall
7 Jian Guo Men South Avenue
Dongcheng District, Beijing
Beijing 100005, China

„Das ist doch kein Name für ne Band“ (2012). Seit der Debüt EP und der Singleauskopplung „Affengeld“ sind KMPFSPRT aus der deutschen Punk-Szene nicht mehr wegzudenken. Die Kölner Band spielte hunderte Live-Auftritte und unzählige Festivalshows. Sie supportete unter anderem Casper und tourte mit Adam Angst, Jennifer Rostock und Saves The Day. 2014 veröffentlichten KMPFSPRT ihr gefeiertes Debüt Album „Jugend mutiert“. Am 29. Punk Legende Walter Schreifels findet lobende Worte: "KMPFSPRT klingen wie eine Mischung aus „Hot Water Music“ und „Title Fight“, nur auf deutsch.“

1232493353449349.description:
Now in its’ fifth year, this popular event brought to you by the Stanford Wine Route raises funds for the Butterfly Foundation and thereby the Butterfly Centre in Stanford. NPO Number168-212
Read more about the centre and its’ ideals on the attached letter. 

The Stanford Stumble is an awesome day out for the whole family, and entails a gentle meander (or a run, if you are that way inclined) through the vineyards, with teams encouraged to dress in their most outrageous outfits. 

What makes for even more fun is the fact that traditional water stops are replaced by wine stations enroute, and many new friendships have been forged along the way. We are grateful to have the support of the Stanford Wine Route, ensuring that participants can sample some of the fine wines available from this area. 

The race will be started by Alissa Coetzee, our Miss Teen Commonwealth SA finalist and supporter of the Butterfly Centre. Her efforts in 2016 already raised over R40 000 for the cause!

After the race there is a variety of local live music, food, face painting and a cash bar. The venue is fantastic for children, with its’ jungle gym, trampoline, and rowboats on the dam.

This year there will be a spit braai for R100 per adult, and all proceeds from this will also be for the Butterfly Centre. 

Registration is from 3pm, race starts 4pm. After the race we will hold a short auction as well as judging and prizes before the full festivities kick off. This includes a prize for best Movember mo, best dressed and best team spirit. 

Entry fees are R100 per adult and R50 per child, special rates for larger teams. 

See a movie of the 2014 event here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1DOKtwuUGl4 

The race entry fees, auction income, full income from the spit braai and a portion of drink sales are for charity, in the name of the Butterfly Foundation. 100% of the funds raised this year will be handed to the Butterfly Centre,  a wonderful institution catering to the needs of special needs children, and ensuring that these kids are able to learn to their full potential in a happy environment filled with love and laughter. 
Please join us for a fun day out, for a very good cause. Further info 028 341 0841.

996345520401572.loc_name: KINGDOM HEARTS Orchestra - World Tour - (New York)
996345520401572.description:
From Hollywood to Westminster, from the Champs Elysée to the Marunouchi, the first official symphonic concert of Kingdom Hearts is set to enchant the world starting March 10, 2017 in Tokyo. Uniting the worlds and characters of FINAL FANTASY and Disney to create a brand new thrilling mythology, Kingdom Hearts follows the adventures of Sora, Goofy and Donald as they rescue their friends and the whole world. With two major games, Kingdom Hearts I and II, released on PlayStation 2 (and re-released in HD on PlayStation 3), and six spin off games over multiple platforms, the saga has touched millions of fans around the globe.

World class professional orchestra, such as the Royal Philarmonic Orchestra in London and the Tokyo Philarmonic Orchestra in Japan, will perform a selection of the best and most beloved music from the original soundtrack of the whole saga.  The concert will feature more than 70 musicians on stage, with amazing HD video cinematics supervised by director Testuya Nomura himself. It will premiere in Tokyo on 10, 2017, and tour the world henceforth. The long awaited official orchestral concert is about to start, so prepare to unleash again the power of the Keyblades and don’t miss this new adventure and experience!

New York: Pre-sales and exclusive VIP tickets available at shop.wildfaery.com starting April 30, 2016. 
Also available May 14, 2016 at www.ticketfly.com

331448070521977.loc_name: French Kiss presents Paranoid London // A Guy Called Gerald
331448070521977.description:
French Kiss Presents...

A Guy Called Gerald (LIVE)
Paranoid London (LIVE)
Alex FROM QUEENS 

BAD ROOM:
Ital (LIVE)
John Barclay 
SIKK LAFFTER

Breaking beats since 1988, A Guy Called Gerald has been an iconic name in the electronic music scene worldwide for over 20 years. One of the UK's finest, most respected, innovative and forward thinking home-grown electronic music producers. He is the Godfather of Acid House and pioneered the style which became drum'n'bass with his visions, his stylistic versatility and open mindedness having a huge influence on the development of global dance culture.

Gerardo Delgado and Quinn Whalley's music as Paranoid London reveres a certain tradition. They use vintage hardware, and most of their records are pressed on 180g vinyl with simple artwork and minimal fuss. Their sound has always been inspired by the old school. They sold more of their debut album than anyone else without any press, reviews or promotional copies given away. They destroyed every party/festival they playe including Panorama Bar, Sonar By Night, Dekmantel & the Fabric 16th birthday party. This is the real deal: dirty, repetitive music for DJ's & dancers.


Tickets - $10 first release / $15 second release / $20 at the door

Listen 
https://soundcloud.com/paranoid-london
https://soundcloud.com/aguycalledgerald
https://soundcloud.com/capriccio
https://soundcloud.com/i-t-a-l
